2026-01-01.prayer: God of salvation and love, we are grateful for the gift of your dear son, Jesus Christ. Because of you and your sacrifice, we know true unconditional love. Let us live our lives in ways that share your love with others. Amen.
2026-01-01.doctrinal: God’s love was revealed among us in this way: God sent his only Son into the world so that we might live through him. 1 John 4:9
2026-01-01.daily_watchword: He will remove his people’s disgrace from all the earth. Isaiah 25:8 NIV

2026-01-02.prayer: God of mercy and compassion, in troubling times, help us remember to be a blessing to others, even though it is all too easy to return hate with hate. Let our actions be a reflection of you and your love. Amen.
2026-01-02.doctrinal: Do not repay evil for evil or abuse for abuse, but, on the contrary, repay with a blessing. 1 Peter 3:9
2026-01-02.daily_watchword: He will bless those who fear the LORD, both small and great. Psalm 115:13

2026-01-03.prayer: Holy One, help us be faithful brothers and sisters to the stranger in our midst. Where there is a need, may we feed the hungry, quench their thirst, and show them your love, peace, and comfort. Amen.
2026-01-03.doctrinal: Beloved, you do faithfully whatever you do for the brothers and sisters, even though they are strangers to you. 3 John 5
2026-01-03.daily_watchword: O LORD, do your eyes not look for truth? Jeremiah 5:3

2026-01-04.prayer: Creator of all, on this first Sunday of a new year, may we remember that no human has the power to save us or those we love. Only you and your mercy endure, and salvation comes only through you. We pray for love to conquer injustice. In your peace that surpasses all understanding, we pray. Amen.
2026-01-04.doctrinal: The sick man answered [Jesus], “Sir, I have no man to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up; but while I am coming, another steps down before me.” Jesus said to him, “Rise, take up your bed and walk.” John 5:7-8 NKJV
2026-01-04.daily_watchword: I waited patiently for the LORD; he inclined to me and heard my cry. Psalm 40:1
2026-01-04.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Praise the name of the LORD, for his name alone is exalted; his glory is above earth and heaven. Psalm 148:13

2026-01-05.prayer: God of all creation, you made us in your image and gifted us your unqualified love. May we love all your children in the same way, no matter their color, creed, or where they live. They are yours just as we are yours…one earthly family in gratitude. Amen.
2026-01-05.doctrinal: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father, who loved us and through grace gave us eternal comfort and good hope, comfort your hearts and strengthen them in every good work and word. 2 Thessalonians 2:16-17
2026-01-05.daily_watchword: The LORD is the strength of his people. Psalm 28:8

2026-01-06.prayer: Masterful Creator, you made all that is and gave humans free will, knowing that we would be imperfect and selfish beings. When we try to justify bad behaviors, touch our hearts with Jesus’ words, reminding us that peace comes from forgiveness, not blame. In trust, we pray. Amen.
2026-01-06.doctrinal: And [Jesus] said to them, “Why are you afraid, you of little faith?” Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a dead calm. Matthew 8:26
2026-01-06.daily_watchword: You rule the raging of the sea; when its waves rise, you still them. Psalm 89:9
special_remarks: Epiphany of the Lord — Isaiah 60:1-6; Psalm 72:1-7,10-14
Watchword for the Epiphany — Arise, shine; for your light has come, and the glory of the LORD has risen upon you. Isaiah 60:1

2026-01-07.prayer: Gracious God, you have assured us that no matter what we have done, we can turn from our past and move in a new direction. Help us, Lord, to boldly shine your light for others to see that what we do, we do for you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-01-07.doctrinal: But those who do what is true come to the light, so that it may be clearly seen that their deeds have been done in God. John 3:21
2026-01-07.daily_watchword: Turn back, turn back from your evil ways, for why will you die, O house of Israel? Ezekiel 33:11

2026-01-08.prayer: Mighty Savior, we rely upon your greatness in our lives. We appreciate your desire to be in relationship with us. May all we do shine forth your greatness and your love. We humbly pray, in Jesus’ name. Amen.
2026-01-08.doctrinal: Father, I desire that those also, whom you have given me, may be with me where I am, to see my glory, which you have given me. John 17:24
2026-01-08.daily_watchword: O Lord G!D, you have only begun to show your servant your greatness and your might. Deuteronomy 3:24

2026-01-09.prayer: Compassionate God, we thank you for turning our sorrow and our mourning into joy. We thank you for walking with us in our sufferings and for helping us to see beyond our sufferings toward the life ahead of us. We pray all of this, in Jesus’ name. Amen.
2026-01-09.doctrinal: Our hope for you is unshaken, for we know that as you share in our sufferings, so also you share in our consolation. 2 Corinthians 1:7
2026-01-09.daily_watchword: I will turn their mourning into joy. Jeremiah 31:13

2026-01-10.prayer: Our ultimate Teacher, we thank you for giving us the words to speak when we struggle to express ourselves. Thank you for walking with us when we are tempted to walk away. Thank you for always being near us. We pray, in Jesus’ name. Amen.
2026-01-10.doctrinal: Pay close attention to yourself and to your teaching; continue in these things, for in doing this you will save both yourself and your hearers. 1 Timothy 4:16
2026-01-10.daily_watchword: Far be it from us that we should rebel against the LORD and turn away this day. Joshua 22:29

2026-01-11.prayer: Gracious God, you sent your son to teach us the ways of justice and mercy. We pray for your forgiveness when we have failed to see the face of Christ reflected in our human siblings. Help us to act out your good news every day, in deed as well as word. This, we humbly pray. Amen.
2026-01-11.doctrinal: Go into all the world and proclaim the good news to the whole creation. Mark 16:15
2026-01-11.daily_watchword: The mighty one, God the LORD, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting. Psalm 50:1
2026-01-11.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — A bruised reed he will not break, and a dimly burning wick he will not quench; he will faithfully bring forth justice. Isaiah 42:3

2026-01-12.prayer: Almighty Physician, we pray for healing in our lives and in the lives of others. Our bodies and minds are frail, yet your gentle touch lifts us up. We pray that you grant courage and strength to all those who do the work of healing in our communities every day. Grant unto them your peace. Amen.
2026-01-12.doctrinal: But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father. Luke 9:42
2026-01-12.daily_watchword: O LORD, there is no difference for you between helping the mighty and the weak. 2 Chronicles 14:11

2026-01-13.prayer: God of all, when we despise our neighbor, we despise you. When we scorn our neighbor, we scorn you. Our anger and greed tear down the house you have built for us with your mighty hands. Deliver us from the poison of selfishness. Help us give thanks for your free gift of love by extending that love to others. Amen.
2026-01-13.doctrinal: Jesus answered him, “Those who love me will keep my word, and my Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.” John 14:23
2026-01-13.daily_watchword: The LORD declares: far be it from me, for those who honor me I will honor, and those who despise me shall be treated with contempt. 1 Samuel 2:30

2026-01-14.prayer: Omnipresent God, who follows us into all corners of life, grant us the courage to live in faithful response to your sacred whispers on behalf of those who live in fear, yet seeking mercy amidst unanswered prayers. Grant us the words and actions to “tell the people the whole message about this life.” Amen.
2026-01-14.doctrinal: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors, brought them out, and said, “Go, stand in the temple and tell the people the whole message about this life.” Acts 5:19-20
2026-01-14.daily_watchword: The angel of the LORD encamps around those who fear him and delivers them. Psalm 34:7

2026-01-15.prayer: At the dawn of each new day, gracious Savior, may we rise with praise on our lips and gladness in our hearts. May such praise become hope for those who hear it, and may our gladness bring courage to those who walk silently and with heavy hearts. Amen.
2026-01-15.doctrinal: All nations will come and worship before you, for your judgments have been revealed. Revelation 15:4
2026-01-15.daily_watchword: O come, let us sing to the LORD; let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation! Psalm 95:1

2026-01-16.prayer: Creator of all that is, ever has been, and all that is yet to come—unite us in our best efforts to be your Gospel in this day. Thus, may our best selves be inspired by your Spirit to embrace the wonderful tapestry of your creation, not only our siblings in faith, but also those feeling marginalized, homeless in body and faith, or cast out from the care of community. Amen.
2026-01-16.doctrinal: For in the one Spirit we were all baptized into one body—Jews or Greeks, slaves or free— and we were all made to drink of one Spirit. 1 Corinthians 12:13
2026-01-16.daily_watchword: Let us go with you, for we have heard that God is with you. Zechariah 8:23

2026-01-17.prayer: Comforting Lord, we come to you today with thanksgiving as we reflect on the safety of your arms. You are a place of refuge when we feel weary; a place of wholeness when we feel broken; a place of love when we feel forgotten. Be with us, Lord, as we go through this day and may we remember to turn to you always. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
2026-01-17.doctrinal: When [Blind Bartimaeus] heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to shout out and say, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!” Mark 10:47
2026-01-17.daily_watchword: The LORD is my refuge. Psalm 91:9 NIV

2026-01-18.prayer: Gracious God, we are thankful for your presence in our lives. Your peace brings us comfort and your grace brings us hope. May we always remember to lift our burdens to you and leave them in your merciful arms. We pray this in your loving name. Amen.
2026-01-18.doctrinal: Grace, mercy, and peace will be with us from God the Father and from Jesus Christ, the Father’s Son, in truth and love. 2 John 3
2026-01-18.daily_watchword: I will make peace your governor and well-being your ruler. Isaiah 60:17 NIV
2026-01-18.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — God is faithful; by him you were called into the fellowship of his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord. 1 Corinthians 1:9

2026-01-19.prayer: Lord, we turn to you to seek your guidance. May we trust your words as we listen to the still small voice inside. You are an amazing God who will never let us go, and for this we are thankful. Amen.
2026-01-19.doctrinal: Jesus said, “The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and life.” John 6:63
2026-01-19.daily_watchword: First seek the counsel of the LORD. 2 Chronicles 18:4 NIV

2026-01-20.prayer: Protecting God, when the whole world feels out of control, your power never waivers. You are the source of our strength and our divine leader. Help us to place our trust in you and only you. Amen.
2026-01-20.doctrinal: For we did not follow cleverly devised myths when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we had been eyewitnesses of his majesty. 2 Peter 1:16
2026-01-20.daily_watchword: With many dreams come vanities and a multitude of words, but fear God. Ecclesiastes 5:7

2026-01-21.prayer: As a deer longs for flowing streams, so my soul longs for you, O God. We thirst, and you provide a spring of water gushing with eternal life. Quench our spiritual yearnings with the Savior’s presence and peace. Amen.
2026-01-21.doctrinal: So we are always confident, even though we know that while we are at home in the body we are away from the Lord—for we walk by faith, not by sight. 2 Corinthians 5:6-7
2026-01-21.daily_watchword: My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When shall I come and behold the face of God? Psalm 42:2

2026-01-22.prayer: Gracious God, we were pilgrims without a guide, ambassadors without a mission, sheep without a shepherd, disciples without a master, sinners without a savior. We thank you for answering our deepest spiritual needs in the person of Jesus Christ. Amen.
2026-01-22.doctrinal: Remember that you were at that time without Christ, having no hope and without God in the world. But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ. Ephesians 2:12-13
2026-01-22.daily_watchword: Those he gathered from the lands, from east and west, from north and south: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his unfailing love and his wonderful deeds for mankind. Psalm 107:3,8 NIV

2026-01-23.prayer: Lord Jesus, you have brought God’s glorious kingdom into greater focus. When you healed the sick, we began to see a day of healing and wholeness for all creation. When you fed the multitudes, we saw a day when there would be hunger no more. When you forgave sinners, we saw a day when all people would be reconciled. Draw us deeper into your kingdom to live on earth as in heaven. Amen.
2026-01-23.doctrinal: He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of his kingdom there will be no end. Luke 1:33
2026-01-23.daily_watchword: The LORD will reign forever and ever. Exodus 15:18

2026-01-24.prayer: God of generations, thank you for the women and men who have gone before us, faithfully working for the coming of your kingdom. Help us to join them in making Christ, who teaches us to care for the weak and forgotten, the cornerstone whom we ourselves love and serve. Amen.
2026-01-24.doctrinal: You are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, with Christ Jesus himself as the cornerstone. Ephesians 2:20
2026-01-24.daily_watchword: Their congregation shall be established before me. Jeremiah 30:20

2026-01-25.prayer: Creator of galaxies, maker of atoms, you give breath to everything we know and much we do not know. Give us the wisdom and determination to preserve your earth with all its peoples, creatures, and intricate ecosystems. Accept our care of creation as our way to love, worship, and serve you. Amen.
2026-01-25.doctrinal: Ever since the creation of the world God’s eternal power and divine nature, invisible though they are, have been seen and understood through the things God has made. Romans 1:20
2026-01-25.daily_watchword: It is I who by my great power and my outstretched arm have made the earth, with the people and animals that are on the earth, and I give it to whomever I please. Jeremiah 27:5
2026-01-25.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The LORD is the stronghold of my life; of whom shall I be afraid? Psalm 27:1

2026-01-26.prayer: You do not use your power, God, to press us down. Instead, you lift us up, giving us hopeful thoughts to think and loving words to speak. Be with us and the leaders we empower. Help us and our leaders to grow in love for you and our neighbors. Amen.
2026-01-26.doctrinal: First of all, then, I urge that supplications, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings be made for everyone, for kings and all who are in high positions. 1 Timothy 2:1-2
2026-01-26.daily_watchword: He changes times and seasons, deposes kings and sets up kings. Daniel 2:21

2026-01-27.prayer: Lord of all, forgive us when we doubt your word and fail to trust in your power to deliver us in times of danger and distress. Forgive us when we feel alone in a world where cruelty seems to prevail and our faith is tested—even by those closest to us. Thank you for the blessed assurance of your word, which reminds us that we can rest in your unfailing protection. Amen.
2026-01-27.doctrinal: Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go to such and such a town and spend a year there, doing business and making money.” Instead you ought to say, “If the Lord wishes, we will live and do this or that.” James 4:13,15
2026-01-27.daily_watchword: For my thoughts are not your thoughts, nor are your ways my ways, says the LORD. Isaiah 55:8

2026-01-28.prayer: Compassionate God, you have called us to be bold in our faith, to fear no one, but trust in your divine care. Strengthen our hearts when we face opposition, reminding us that you see and value every sparrow—yet how much more you care for us! Help us to stand firm, to confess you before others, and to take up our cross daily, knowing that true life is found in you. May we love you above all else and walk in obedience, knowing that in losing our lives for your sake, we find the greatest reward. Amen.
2026-01-28.doctrinal: [Jairus] pleaded earnestly with [Jesus], “My little daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so that she will be healed and live.” Mark 5:23 NIV
2026-01-28.daily_watchword: Do not forsake me, O LORD; O my God, do not be far from me. Psalm 38:21

2026-01-29.prayer: Loving Savior, when doubts arise, remind us of your mighty works and unfailing promises. Like John the Baptist, we seek assurance in times of uncertainty— help us to trust that you are the one who brings healing, restoration, and salvation. Open our hearts to recognize your presence and follow your ways. May we live as messengers of your truth, preparing the way for others to know you. Amen.
2026-01-29.doctrinal: And he stood up and immediately took the mat and went out before all of them, so that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!” Mark 2:12
2026-01-29.daily_watchword: You have multiplied, O LORD my God, your wondrous deeds and your thoughts toward us; none can compare with you. Psalm 40:5

2026-01-30.prayer: Provider, just like the loaves and the fish, you know our needs, and we lift those needs to you each day. Your care for us is tender and beautiful and we are filled with gratitude for your love. Amen.
2026-01-30.doctrinal: Taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and blessed and broke the loaves and gave them to his disciples to set before the people, and he divided the two fish among them all. And all ate and were filled. Mark 6:41-42
2026-01-30.daily_watchword: In response to his people the LORD said, “I am sending you grain, wine, and oil, and you will be satisfied.” Joel 2:19

2026-01-31.prayer: Holy Redeemer, we want to shout on the mountain tops our praise for you. Even on the darkest days of winter, your love and redemption see us through. You are always worthy of all our praise. Amen.
2026-01-31.doctrinal: Jumping up, he stood and began to walk, and he entered the temple with them, walking and leaping and praising God. Acts 3:8
2026-01-31.daily_watchword: For you, O LORD, have made me glad by your work; at the works of your hands I sing for joy. Psalm 92:4

2026-02-01.prayer: Morning Star, as the morning dew fades and your loving spirit rises, abide with us today. With each passing encounter, as children of the King of grace, may we give our best efforts to those in need of comfort, insight, and love. Amen.
2026-02-01.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Abide in my love.” John 15:9
2026-02-01.daily_watchword: Your love is like the dew that goes away early. Hosea 6:4
2026-02-01.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — For the message about the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God. 1 Corinthians 1:18

2026-02-02.prayer: Morning Star, on this day of new opportunities, may we rise up with boldness and meet each challenge with resolve and integrity. Let us embrace the protectiveness of Joseph, the tenderness of Mary, and the resilience of the kings. Amen.
2026-02-02.doctrinal: Do not, therefore, abandon that boldness of yours; it brings a great reward. Hebrews 10:35
2026-02-02.daily_watchword: But when they cried out to the LORD, he raised up for them a deliverer, who saved them. Judges 3:9 NIV

2026-02-03.prayer: Morning Star, travel with us this today. Inspire us to help those in need of aid. Let us give them a helping hand, a tender ear or do a simple task, and be the wiser and better for our efforts to show your grace. Amen.
2026-02-03.doctrinal: Has not God chosen the poor in the world to be rich in faith and to be heirs of the kingdom that he has promised to those who love him? James 2:5
2026-02-03.daily_watchword: Those who mock the poor insult their Maker; those who are glad at calamity will not go unpunished. Proverbs 17:5

2026-02-04.prayer: Divine God, come and guide us this day. Help us see the needs of others and give us the willingness to meet those needs with an unjudging spirit of love. Amen.
2026-02-04.doctrinal: I am the vine; you are the branches. Those who abide in me and I in them bear much fruit. John 15:5
2026-02-04.daily_watchword: Blessed are those who trust in the LORD, like a tree planted by water, sending out its roots by the stream. In the year of drought it is not anxious, and it does not cease to bear fruit. Jeremiah 17:7,8

2026-02-05.prayer: Divine God, let your light beacon our steps of hope to the weak and forgotten friend-travelers. Let us deliver a balm of optimism and help restore hope by walking beside others, moving forward, out of weariness and despair, into full renewal. Amen.
2026-02-05.doctrinal: But the Lord is faithful; he will strengthen you and guard you from the evil one. 2 Thessalonians 3:3
2026-02-05.daily_watchword: Protect me, O God, for in you I take refuge. Psalm 16:1

2026-02-06.prayer: Divine God, wash the biased dirt out of our eyes. Delete our sins. Forgive our wayward ramblings. Restore your clearer sight in us, so we may better serve those entrusted to our care. Amen.
2026-02-06.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Then he will answer them, ‘Truly I tell you, just as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to me.’” Matthew 25:45
2026-02-06.daily_watchword: Lord, you are righteous, but this day we are covered with shame. Daniel 9:7 NIV

2026-02-07.prayer: Comforting Jesus, we think we are in charge of our own lives. Holy Spirit, we control far less than we imagine. Let our wills bow before your authority and experience your truth and peace. Amen.
2026-02-07.doctrinal: For he is our peace. Ephesians 2:14
2026-02-07.daily_watchword: Great will be his authority, and there shall be endless peace. Isaiah 9:7

2026-02-08.prayer: Comforting Jesus, as your star guided the wisemen to the toddler king, may we, too, pass our gifts of time, talent, and treasure to the church we serve locally, and then rejoice with thanksgiving. Amen.
2026-02-08.doctrinal: They broke bread at home and ate their food with glad and generous hearts, praising God and having the goodwill of all the people. Acts 2:46-47
2026-02-08.daily_watchword: The Lord has done great things for us, and we rejoiced. Psalm 126:3
2026-02-08.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — For I decided to know nothing among you except Jesus Christ, and him crucified. 1 Corinthians 2:2

2026-02-09.prayer: Comforting Jesus, inspire us to listen to the “other voices” of the immigrants among us. Help us to not look over them but instead look into their eyes and hear their stories. May what we hear remind us of our own immigrant roots and may we see them as friend-travelers, not enemies. Amen.
2026-02-09.doctrinal: Jesus said, “You are my friends if you do what I command you.” John 15:14
2026-02-09.daily_watchword: When a foreigner resides among you in your land, do not mistreat them. Leviticus 19:33 NIV

2026-02-10.prayer: Kindly Light, brighten our path and guide our feet along the trail, sharing your compassionate acts of light with every friend-traveler we meet on this magnificent day. Amen.
2026-02-10.doctrinal: But for that very reason I received mercy, so that in me, as the foremost, Jesus Christ might display the utmost patience as an example to those who would come to believe in him for eternal life. 1 Timothy 1:16
2026-02-10.daily_watchword: Jacob said, “I am not worthy of the least of all the steadfast love and all the faithfulness that you have shown to your servant.” Genesis 32:10

2026-02-11.prayer: Kindly Light, shine on us this day with beauty abundant. Help us to better grasp our charge to lead and serve others with vigor, frankness, and mercy. May we lavish others with kindnesses to warm their souls. Amen.
2026-02-11.doctrinal: God has not rejected his people whom he foreknew. Romans 11:2
2026-02-11.daily_watchword: Is Ephraim my dear son? Is he the child in whom I delight? As often as I speak against him, I still remember him. Therefore I am deeply moved for him; I will surely have mercy on him, says the LORD. Jeremiah 31:20

2026-02-12.prayer: Kindly Light, your mercy untangles our many personal sins. Your witness, through Jesus, holds us accountable for our actions and inactions. Forgive us. Redeem us. Return us to the lighted path of purpose. Amen.
2026-02-12.doctrinal: You know that he was revealed to take away sins, and in him there is no sin. 1 John 3:5
2026-02-12.daily_watchword: I have swept away your transgressions like a cloud and your sins like mist; return to me, for I have redeemed you. Isaiah 44:22

2026-02-13.prayer: Radiant Master, your spirit of love and purpose pours through us this day to make a difference in our neighborhoods. May we gleam with humility. Grace our sweaty brows with mercy. Amen.
2026-02-13.doctrinal: As you therefore have received Christ Jesus the Lord, continue to walk in him, rooted and built up in him and established in the faith, just as you were taught, abounding in thanksgiving. Colossians 2:6-7
2026-02-13.daily_watchword: But if you do not obey the LORD, and if you rebel against his commands, his hand will be against you, as it was against your ancestors. 1 Samuel 12:15 NIV

2026-02-14.prayer: Radiant Master, lead us this full day showing others creative engagement and abundant compassion. May we show tender mercies to our neighbors near and far. Amen.
2026-02-14.doctrinal: Meanwhile the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria had peace and was built up. Living in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, it increased in numbers. Acts 9:31
2026-02-14.daily_watchword: He guards the lives of his faithful; he rescues them from the hand of the wicked. Psalm 97:10

2026-02-15.prayer: Radiant Master, as Joseph forgave his brothers for their jealous actions, may we do the same in our own families. May our acts of personal clemency help heal the divisions within our homes and influence our neighbors toward forgiveness. Amen.
2026-02-15.doctrinal: Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ has forgiven you. Ephesians 4:32
2026-02-15.daily_watchword: Joseph’s brothers said, “Now therefore please forgive the crime of the servants of the God of your father.” Genesis 50:17
2026-02-15.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — God said, “This is my Son, the Beloved; with him I am well pleased; listen to him!” Matthew 17:5

2026-02-16.prayer: Risen Redeemer, we rise this day to be influencers of goodness and change in your world through Christian morals and actions. Let us be like the angels among us, bringing joy to God’s children. Amen.
2026-02-16.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Then he will send out the angels and gather the elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of heaven.” Mark 13:27
2026-02-16.daily_watchword: See, I am sending my messenger to prepare the way before me. Malachi 3:1

2026-02-17.prayer: Risen Redeemer, we await the beginning of another renewing Lenten journey. May we not binge too loosely this “Fat Tuesday”, for we are still called to “teach the splendor of your ways,” every day. Amen.
2026-02-17.doctrinal: They shall have the knowledge of God’s mystery, that is, Christ, in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge. Colossians 2:2-3
2026-02-17.daily_watchword: The secret things belong to the LORD our God, but the revealed things belong to us and to our children forever. Deuteronomy 29:29

2026-02-18.prayer: Risen Redeemer, we enter our 40 days of spiritual journey looking inward to fortify and bolster our faithfulness. Guard our hearts, empower our understanding, strengthen our souls, and heal our shortcomings during this time of reflection. Amen.
2026-02-18.doctrinal: They were all astounded and kept saying to one another, “What kind of word is this, that with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits and they come out?” Luke 4:36
2026-02-18.daily_watchword: Let your steadfast love come to me, O LORD, your salvation according to your promise. Psalm 119:41

2026-02-19.prayer: Risen Redeemer, when the morning rays reach our countenances, our souls warm and you comfort us to motivate, delegate, and instigate goodness and grace in a cold and sometimes bitter world. Amen.
2026-02-19.doctrinal: May the God of steadfastness and encouragement grant you to live in harmony with one another, in accordance with Christ Jesus, so that together you may with one voice glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. Romans 15:5-6
2026-02-19.daily_watchword: Bless our God, O peoples; let the sound of his praise be heard, who has kept us among the living and has not let our feet slip. Psalm 66:8-9

2026-02-20.prayer: Risen Redeemer, deepen our Lenten disciplines. As we look spiritually inward, bolster our confidence to reach out and bring others to you. May we grow morally and spiritually. Amen.
2026-02-20.doctrinal: May mercy, peace, and love be yours in abundance. Jude 2
2026-02-20.daily_watchword: Do not, O LORD, withhold your mercy from me; let your steadfast love and your faithfulness keep me safe forever. Psalm 40:11

2026-02-21.prayer: Renewing Savior, lead us forward, guide us onward, and rekindle our purpose as we serve, live, and worship together. As we renew our walk, may we revitalize our personal service with our local church. Amen.
2026-02-21.doctrinal: So if anyone is in Christ, there is a new creation: everything old has passed away; look, new things have come into being! 2 Corinthians 5:17
2026-02-21.daily_watchword: Do not remember the former things or consider the things of old. I am about to do a new thing; now it springs forth; do you not perceive it? Isaiah 43:18-19

2026-02-22.prayer: Renewing Savior, let us not look away from the poor and the needy in our neighborhoods, but instead, let us find positive, practical ways to engage with those in need. May our service to them help restore their bodies, hearts, minds, and souls through lovingkindness. Amen.
2026-02-22.doctrinal: For you know the generous act of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, so that by his poverty you might become rich. 2 Corinthians 8:9
2026-02-22.daily_watchword: The meek shall obtain fresh joy in the LORD, and the neediest people shall exult in the Holy One of Israel. Isaiah 29:19
2026-02-22.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, O righteous, and shout for joy, all you upright in heart. Psalm 32:11

2026-02-23.prayer: Renewing Savior, during this Lenten quest for a confident walk with Jesus, restore our desire and duty to serve and share mercy with others. Bless our souls with action. Let your love shine through us today. Amen.
2026-02-23.doctrinal: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, for he has looked favorably on his people and redeemed them. Luke 1:68
2026-02-23.daily_watchword: Shout, make your praises heard, and say, “LORD, save your people.” Jeremiah 31:7 NIV

2026-02-24.prayer: Renewing Savior, may we be committed today to provide food for the body, knowledge for the mind, comfort for the spirit, and purpose for the soul. We await this day as an opportunity for discipleship. Amen.
2026-02-24.doctrinal: If a brother or sister is naked and lacks daily food and one of you says to them, “Go in peace; keep warm and eat your fill,” and yet you do not supply their bodily needs, what is the good of that? James 2:15-16
2026-02-24.daily_watchword: I know that the LORD maintains the cause of the needy and executes justice for the poor. Psalm 140:12

2026-02-25.prayer: Leading Shepherd, let us hear your clear voice, calling us out of our occasional spiritual complacency and into a more active love, which tears down walls and transforms them into bridges for our neighbors to cross. Amen.
2026-02-25.doctrinal: A voice from the cloud said, “This is my Son, the Beloved; with him I am well pleased; listen to him!” Matthew 17:5
2026-02-25.daily_watchword: I am the LORD; I have called you in righteousness; I have taken you by the hand. Isaiah 42:6

2026-02-26.prayer: Loving Father, as this month draws to a close, your love for us draws nearer to our heart. From that loving care, help us as we trek outward to rectify, rejuvenate, and revive the people of your church. Amen.
2026-02-26.doctrinal: But even if you do suffer for doing what is right, you are blessed. 1 Peter 3:14
2026-02-26.daily_watchword: But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn, which shines brighter and brighter until full day. Proverbs 4:18

2026-02-27.prayer: Loving Son, continue to show and teach us better ways to handle strife, grief, bitterness, anger, and self-righteousness among our neighbors. Motivate us to reach out in love and truth, bringing reconciliation that yields healing and forgiveness. Amen.
2026-02-27.doctrinal: And will not God grant justice to his chosen ones who cry to him day and night? Will he delay long in helping them? I tell you, he will quickly grant justice to them. Luke 18:7-8
2026-02-27.daily_watchword: Let your ear be attentive and your eyes open to hear the prayer of your servant that I now pray before you day and night for your servants. Nehemiah 1:6

2026-02-28.prayer: Loving Holy Spirit, like a mother tending to the various needs of her spiritual family, restore and heal us, so that we may lead others with courage and fortitude to move and change the landscape of our neighborhoods. Amen.
2026-02-28.doctrinal: For we are what he has made us, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand so that we may walk in them. Ephesians 2:10
2026-02-28.daily_watchword: You turn things upside down! Shall the potter be regarded as the clay? Shall the thing made say of its maker, “He did not make me,” or the thing formed say of the one who formed it, “He has no understanding?” Isaiah 29:16

2026-03-01.prayer: Loving God, you ask us to turn our hearts to you. Why is it so difficult to follow your statutes? Accept us in our strengths and weakness as we seek to fulfill your call: love God, love neighbor, love self. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2026-03-01.doctrinal: For the love of God is this, that we obey his commandments. And his commandments are not burdensome. 1 John 5:3
2026-03-01.daily_watchword: Be very careful, therefore, to love the LORD your God. Joshua 23:11
2026-03-01.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — For God so loved the world that he gave his only Son, so that everyone who believes in him may not perish but may have eternal life. John 3:16
special_remarks: Beginning of the Unity of the Brethren in Bohemia

2026-03-02.prayer: God of community, you gather your creation in your arms and hold it gently in your care. Help us to treat one another as siblings in your love and remind us that we have more that connects us than divides us. Amen.
2026-03-02.doctrinal: Many will come from east and west and will take their places at the banquet with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven. Matthew 8:11
2026-03-02.daily_watchword: All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn to the LORD. Psalm 22:27

2026-03-03.prayer: Forgive us, Lord, we pray. Remove our sins and help us to walk in your path of righteousness. We turn our lives back to you, merciful God, as we strive to live in the fullness of your love. Amen.
2026-03-03.doctrinal: John the Baptist said, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven has come near.” Matthew 3:2
2026-03-03.daily_watchword: So the Israelites cried to the LORD, saying, “We have sinned against you, because we have abandoned our God.” Judges 10:10

2026-03-04.prayer: You tell us to ask for what we need, Lord, but what if we don’t know what we need? We come and sit in your presence, our hearts and minds open to your leading. Our spirits cry for your guidance. Lord, help us. Amen.
2026-03-04.doctrinal: If you, then, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask him! Matthew 7:11
2026-03-04.daily_watchword: Take delight in the LORD, and he will give you the desires of your heart. Psalm 37:4

2026-03-05.prayer: Obedience is hard for your children, mothering God. Even when we disobey, you guide us back to the paths which will bring us life. Bless us as we try to follow your ways and lead us gently back to life. Amen.
2026-03-05.doctrinal: You are worthy, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things, and by your will they existed and were created. Revelation 4:11
2026-03-05.daily_watchword: My hand laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand spread out the heavens; when I summon them, they stand at attention. Isaiah 48:13

2026-03-06.prayer: God of abundance, all we have is yours. Help us to rid ourselves of the excesses that lead us away from you and from your call to serve. Help us relinquish that which separates us from seeing others’ needs and rejoice in all you have given us. Amen.
2026-03-06.doctrinal: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “There is still one thing lacking. Sell all that you own and distribute the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; then come, follow me.” Luke 18:22
2026-03-06.daily_watchword: The righteous know the rights of the poor. Proverbs 29:7

2026-03-07.prayer: God, we see you in the faces of all we encounter in your beloved creation. We see you in joy and in sorrow, in the persecuted and in the free. We see you walking among us, working alongside us, struggling and rejoicing with us. We see you, God! Amen.
2026-03-07.doctrinal: Jesus said to him, “Whoever has seen me has seen the Father.” John 14:9
2026-03-07.daily_watchword: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Our God is in the heavens; he does whatever he pleases. Psalm 115:2-3

2026-03-08.prayer: We kneel and pray to you, ever-present Savior, so we may hear your call. We are thankful you call us by name and into your service. Give us strength of heart, mind, body, and spirit to follow you. Amen.
2026-03-08.doctrinal: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for I must stay at your house today.” Luke 19:5
2026-03-08.daily_watchword: My lord, if I find favor with you, do not pass by your servant. Genesis 18:3
2026-03-08.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — O come, let us worship and bow down, let us kneel before the LORD, our Maker! Psalm 95:6

2026-03-09.prayer: It feels chaotic around us, God! We know you brought order out of chaos at the beginning of the world; show us how to bring your peace and healing to all that you created. May we be instruments of your peace to help clear the chaos and restore your shalom. Amen.
2026-03-09.doctrinal: From one ancestor he made all peoples to inhabit the whole earth. Acts 17:26
2026-03-09.daily_watchword: The heavens are yours; the earth also is yours; the world and all that is in it—you founded them. The north and the south—you created them. Psalm 89:11-12

2026-03-10.prayer: What does boldness look like to you, loving God? Is it standing in a lion’s den or stepping out of a boat or defying tyrants? To that you say, “yes,” and promise to stand with us. Teach us to be bold in our words, thoughts, and actions. Amen.
2026-03-10.doctrinal: Grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness. Acts 4:29
2026-03-10.daily_watchword: Do not fear, for I am with you; do not be afraid, for I am your God. Isaiah 41:10

2026-03-11.prayer: Ever hope-giving God, we lay down our stress, fear, and anxiety to live in the promise that you restore. As you gave new life to others, we ask for the same blessing for ourselves. Restore us mind, body, and spirit, Lord. Amen.
2026-03-11.doctrinal: That evening they brought to him many who were possessed by demons, and he cast out the spirits with a word and cured all who were sick. Matthew 8:16
2026-03-11.daily_watchword: My soul languishes for your salvation; I hope in your word. Psalm 119:81

2026-03-12.prayer: In this Lenten season, we acknowledge the suffering you faced, Lord. Though you did not deserve your sacrifice, we express our gratitude. May the promise of your salvation fill us with awe and wonder. Let us contemplate what that means in our lives and in our relationship with you. Amen.
2026-03-12.doctrinal: He was delivered over to death for our sins and was raised to life for our justification. Romans 4:25 NIV
2026-03-12.daily_watchword: By his bruises we are healed. Isaiah 53:5

2026-03-13.prayer: We try, patient Savior, to do as you ask and require of us. Forgive us when we falter and stray. Please do not take your steadying hand from us, so we may continue to keep trying. Amen.
2026-03-13.doctrinal: [Peter] cried out, “Lord, save me!” Jesus immediately reached out his hand and caught him, saying to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?” Matthew 14:30-31
2026-03-13.daily_watchword: Our steps are made firm by the LORD when he delights in our way; though we stumble, we shall not fall headlong, for the LORD holds us by the hand. Psalm 37:23-24

2026-03-14.prayer: You freed us from oppressive sin ruling us so that we can live fully in you, God. Remind us that we were freed through love so that others may also be freed. Let us rejoice in this grace and mercy and not hoard it for ourselves. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2026-03-14.doctrinal: For you were called to freedom, brothers and sisters, only do not use your freedom as an opportunity for self-indulgence, but through love become enslaved to one another. Galatians 5:13
2026-03-14.daily_watchword: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery. Exodus 20:2

2026-03-15.prayer: No matter where we go, near or far, you promise to be with us, Lord. You watch over our lives, providing comfort and challenge. Thank you for always being with us and considering us to be valuable. May we always remember your love is never-ending. Amen.
2026-03-15.doctrinal: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground apart from your Father. So do not be afraid; you are of more value than many sparrows. Matthew 10:29,31
2026-03-15.daily_watchword: For God has power to help or to overthrow. 2 Chronicles 25:8
2026-03-15.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD my whole life long. Psalm 23:6

2026-03-16.prayer: Lord, may we never stop being curious about your love and goodness, no matter our age. May we never become so rigid in our thinking that you cannot break through with new revelations. Keep us open and malleable to your guidance and words. Amen.
2026-03-16.doctrinal: How from childhood you have known sacred writings that are able to instruct you for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus. 2 Timothy 3:15
2026-03-16.daily_watchword: O God, from my youth you have taught me, and I still proclaim your wondrous deeds. Psalm 71:17

2026-03-17.prayer: We rely on you, delivering Father, to protect, correct, and guide all of creation with justice and righteousness. May we remember how blessed we are to be counted among your beloveds who call you Abba! In that, we rejoice! Amen.
2026-03-17.doctrinal: After Jesus had spoken these words, he looked up to heaven and said, “Father, glorify your son so that the son may glorify you, since you have given him authority over all people, to give eternal life to all whom you have given him.” John 17:1,2
2026-03-17.daily_watchword: See now that I, even I, am he; there is no god besides me. I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal; and no one can deliver from my hand. Deuteronomy 32:39

2026-03-18.prayer: Your promises, loving God, are never-ending. You give us strength, wisdom, and courage. You are as compassionate as a loving parent when we fail. You are above all, gracious and merciful as we seek to do your will. Thank you. Amen.
2026-03-18.doctrinal: Very truly, I tell you, if you ask anything of the Father in my name, he will give it to you. John 16:23
2026-03-18.daily_watchword: Turn to me and be gracious to me; give your strength to your servant. Psalm 86:16

2026-03-19.prayer: God of the beginning and of the end, you hold every part of our lives in your hands. Wherever we are on our walk of life, we dedicate it to your service. We place our trust in you and you alone. Amen.
2026-03-19.doctrinal: I came that they may have life and have it abundantly. John 10:10
2026-03-19.daily_watchword: Then I myself will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the lands where I have driven them, and I will bring them back to their fold, and they shall be fruitful and multiply. Jeremiah 23:3

2026-03-20.prayer: Even in our weakness, omniscient God, you see us as your wonderfully created people. We give thanks that you can take our flawed and sinful lives and turn them towards you. What did we do to deserve this love, O God? We give you thanks. Amen.
2026-03-20.doctrinal: Wretched person that I am! Who will rescue me from this body of death? Thanks be to God through Jesus Christ our Lord! Romans 7:24-25
2026-03-20.daily_watchword: Consider my affliction and my trouble, and forgive all my sins. Psalm 25:18

2026-03-21.prayer: In Lent, we reflect on your love for us, eternal Caregiver. You have given so much to our lives and continue to provide daily for our existence. Do we recognize this? We pause now and say, “Thank you.” Amen.
2026-03-21.doctrinal: Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift! 2 Corinthians 9:15
2026-03-21.daily_watchword: When you have eaten and are satisfied, praise the LORD your God. Deuteronomy 8:10 NIV

2026-03-22.prayer: God, may the words that our mouths speak be true. May the thoughts and prayers within our hearts uplift. May any good that we do for neighbors and enemies, near and far, be done expressing your unending love for all. We base our lives on you, our rock and redeemer. Amen.
2026-03-22.doctrinal: You know that no lie comes from the truth. 1 John 2:21
2026-03-22.daily_watchword: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor. Exodus 20:16
2026-03-22.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — I wait for the LORD, my soul waits, and in his word I hope. Psalm 130:5

2026-03-23.prayer: The comfort we feel, Lord God, knowing that you and our loving Savior are one is inexpressible! We realize there are mysteries in this world we will never fully comprehend. Let us reside peacefully together knowing your great love for us instead of being divided, debating this great mystery. Amen.
2026-03-23.doctrinal: Jesus said, “The Father and I are one.” John 10:30
2026-03-23.daily_watchword: I, I am the LORD, and besides me there is no savior. Isaiah 43:11

2026-03-24.prayer: If even your son, Jesus Christ, asked for assistance and for difficulties to pass him by, Lord, why do we feel we can handle life on our own? Your angels attended your son, and they lead and guide us as well. Remind us that asking for help is not weakness. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2026-03-24.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me, yet not my will but yours be done.” Then an angel from heaven appeared to him and gave him strength. Luke 22:42-43
2026-03-24.daily_watchword: He will send his angel before you. Genesis 24:7

2026-03-25.prayer: Death and sin did not contain you, miraculous Savior, and neither will they contain us. We thank you for your sacrifice and ask that you teach us to respond to this gift in faith, love, and hope. Amen.
2026-03-25.doctrinal: For he was teaching his disciples, saying to them, “The Son of Man is to be betrayed into human hands, and they will kill him, and three days after being killed, he will rise again.” Mark 9:31
2026-03-25.daily_watchword: Rise up, O LORD! Do not let mortals prevail. Psalm 9:19

2026-03-26.prayer: You made everything, creating God, and thought enough of humankind to call us very good. We praise you that we are good in your sight. May we continually live into our goodness and treat those around us as your beloved. Amen.
2026-03-26.doctrinal: He destined us for adoption as his children through Jesus Christ, according to the good pleasure of his will, to the praise of his glorious grace. Ephesians 1:5-6
2026-03-26.daily_watchword: I will bless the LORD at all times; his praise shall continually be in my mouth. Psalm 34:1

2026-03-27.prayer: Make us, O God, a people who live into the promises you fulfill—the promises of your love and abundant life. This has already been established in your heavenly kingdom. Help us to grow that same peace and love on earth. Amen.
2026-03-27.doctrinal: If you sow to your own flesh, you will reap corruption from the flesh, but if you sow to the Spirit, you will reap eternal life from the Spirit. Galatians 6:8
2026-03-27.daily_watchword: Truly the righteous attain life, but whoever pursues evil finds death. Proverbs 11:19 NIV

2026-03-28.prayer: Rejoice, church! For our God loves us! Rejoice creation! For our God redeems us! Rejoice beloveds! For our God blesses us! Rejoice all that surrounds us, and let our praises extend throughout all the world! Amen!
2026-03-28.doctrinal: Then one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, praising God with a loud voice. Luke 17:15
2026-03-28.daily_watchword: Give us life, and we will call on your name. Psalm 80:18

2026-03-29.prayer: Blessed are you, Jesus Christ! We cry to you to save us, deliver us, and be with us. Bless us with your presence and help us to see clearly the road we walk with you. Hosanna in the highest heaven! Amen.
2026-03-29.doctrinal: So they took branches of palm trees and went out to meet him, shouting, “Hosanna! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord—the King of Israel!” John 12:13
2026-03-29.daily_watchword: And he said to him, “If your presence will not go, do not bring us up from here.” Exodus 33:15
2026-03-29.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — And being found in human form, Jesus humbled himself and became obedient to the point of death—even death on a cross. Philippians 2:7,8

2026-03-30.prayer: Christ simplified the laws for us: love God, love our neighbor, love ourselves. It shouldn’t be hard; let us not make it more difficult to show people your everlasting, unconditional love. Gracious Lord, let your words guide our actions. Amen.
2026-03-30.doctrinal: For I will not be so bold as to speak of anything except what Christ has accomplished through me to win obedience from the gentiles, by word and deed. Romans 15:18
2026-03-30.daily_watchword: You must neither add anything to what I command you nor take away anything from it, but keep the commandments of the LORD your God with which I am charging you. Deuteronomy 4:2

2026-03-31.prayer: You suffered for us on the cross, loving Christ. Your love for us is incomprehensible. How do we say thank you for this? We live a life worthy of being called children and heirs of God. We live a life of love. We offer our heart-felt thanks. Amen.
2026-03-31.doctrinal: Was it not necessary that the Messiah should suffer these things and then enter into his glory? Luke 24:26
2026-03-31.daily_watchword: Indeed, the LORD our God is right in all that he has done. Daniel 9:14

2026-04-01.prayer: We praise you, dear Savior, for all that you do and all that you are. Thank you for blessing us. May our appreciation never stop pouring from our hearts and our voices. Amen.
2026-04-01.doctrinal: Every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father. Philippians 2:11
2026-04-01.daily_watchword: Then I will thank you in the great congregation; in the mighty throng I will praise you. Psalm 35:18

2026-04-02.prayer: Source of life, today especially, we remember you. We remember you as you sat with your disciples one final time. We remember you as you sit with us today. Give unto us your peace. Amen.
2026-04-02.doctrinal: Then he took a cup, and after giving thanks he gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you, for this is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.” Matthew 26:27-28
2026-04-02.daily_watchword: Happy are those whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in the LORD their God. Psalm 146:5
special_remarks: Watchword for Maundy Thursday — He has gained renown by his wonderful deeds; the LORD is gracious and merciful. Psalm 111:4

2026-04-03.prayer: Suffering Savior, the words…the words simply won’t come to express our wonder at the depth of your love that we recall today. Yet you call us to embody this same love, though we can scarcely grasp it. Thousand, thousand thanks to thee, dearest Lord, forever be. Amen.
2026-04-03.doctrinal: In a loud voice they were saying: “Worthy is the Lamb, who was slain, to receive power and wealth and wisdom and strength and honor and glory and praise!” Revelation 5:12 NIV
2026-04-03.daily_watchword: Praise the LORD, all you nations! Extol him, all you peoples! Psalm 117:1
special_remarks: Watchword for Good Friday — For God so loved the world that he gave his only Son, so that everyone who believes in him may not perish but may have eternal life. John 3:16

2026-04-04.prayer: Resting Savior, we mourn your death. In spirit— we visit your resting place and remember your suffering. We thank you that our grief is not like the disciples’ grief, for we know what comes tomorrow. Amen.
2026-04-04.doctrinal: In my Father’s house there are many dwelling places. If it were not so, would I have told you that I go to prepare a place for you? John 14:2
2026-04-04.daily_watchword: How lovely is your dwelling place, O LORD of hosts! Psalm 84:1

2026-04-05.prayer: Finally, God of life, after long, dark days, you make the sun rise once more, for the son has risen. Our lives are changed. Our hope is reborn. Now thank we all our God! Amen.
2026-04-05.doctrinal: The last enemy to be destroyed is death. 1 Corinthians 15:26
2026-04-05.daily_watchword: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies; you anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows. Psalm 23:5
2026-04-05.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — So if you have been raised with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. Colossians 3:1

2026-04-06.prayer: O caring Savior, we are in awe of your word that is shared with us today. How can we grasp such love or fathom such caring? May we simply trust your hands as you hold us. Amen.
2026-04-06.doctrinal: For I am convinced that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor rulers, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers, nor height, nor depth, nor anything else in all creation will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord. Romans 8:38-39
2026-04-06.daily_watchword: He guarded him as the apple of his eye. Deuteronomy 32:10

2026-04-07.prayer: God of liberty and compassion, forgive us when we hoard the comforts of liberty and justice. Deliver us from such temptations. We often close our eyes in indifference to the anguish of others, which is plainly visible if only we would look. Forgive us, O Lord. Amen.
2026-04-07.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Then the king will say to those at his right hand, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world, I was naked and you gave me clothing.’” Matthew 25:34,36

2026-07-16.prayer: Amazing Savior, through your selfless example of sacrifice, even death on the cross, you have taught us what perfect love looks like. As we live out each day in the light of your love, teach us to shine this light on the people we meet along the way. Amen.
2026-07-16.doctrinal: Jesus said to his mother, “Woman, here is your son.” Then he said to the disciple, “Here is your mother.” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own home. John 19:26-27
2026-07-16.daily_watchword: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear. Psalm 46:1-2

2026-07-17.prayer: Wonderful Savior, you have promised to never leave nor forsake us. Your love for us has caused you to humble yourself from your heavenly throne to the dust of the earth. You also promise to raise us from the dust of the earth to the foot of your heavenly throne. May we remain ready for this miraculous transformation. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2026-07-17.doctrinal: Jesus said, “I will not leave you orphaned; I am coming to you.” John 14:18
2026-07-17.daily_watchword: Look down from heaven and see, from your holy and glorious habitation. Where are your zeal and your might? Isaiah 63:15

2026-07-18.prayer: Almighty Creator, you have formed each of us as a unique person, made perfect because we are created in your image. May we always see you in the other as we embrace their limitless potential. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-07-18.doctrinal: Honor one another above yourselves. Romans 12:10 NIV
2026-07-18.daily_watchword: He created them male and female and blessed them. And he named them “Mankind” when they were created. Genesis 5:2 NIV

2026-07-19.prayer: Great Potter, you find us as broken vessels in need of repair. Although broken, you still see in us the perfection of your craftsmanship. Because of you, we are made whole again! May our gratitude be evident for all to see. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-07-19.doctrinal: For our sake God made the one who knew no sin to be sin, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God. 2 Corinthians 5:21
2026-07-19.daily_watchword: O LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your wrath. Psalm 6:1
2026-07-19.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Thus says the LORD, the King of Israel, and his Redeemer, the LORD of hosts: I am the first and I am the last; besides me there is no god. Isaiah 44:6

2026-07-20.prayer: Eternal Covenant, as we pray, we breathe in your promises of forgiveness, salvation, and an eternity spent with you. As we breathe out, we confess your name with worshipful adoration. Thank you for the stillness you provide us with each breath. Amen.
2026-07-20.doctrinal: Jesus answered, “You say that I am a king. For this I was born, and for this I came into the world, to testify to the truth. Everyone who belongs to the truth listens to my voice.” John 18:37
2026-07-20.daily_watchword: The promises of the LORD are promises that are pure, silver refined in a furnace on the ground, purified seven times. Psalm 12:6

2026-07-21.prayer: Patient God, forgive us for requiring that you give us signs and miracles as evience before we embrace belief. This communion with you, through the prayers of our hearts, is the purest, most loving miracle of all. We pray all of this in your name. Amen.
2026-07-21.doctrinal: Now as he was approaching the path down from the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to praise God joyfully with a loud voice for all the deeds of power that they had seen. Luke 19:37
2026-07-21.daily_watchword: Rejoice with Jerusalem, and be glad for her, all you who love her; rejoice with her in joy, all you who mourn over her. Isaiah 66:10

2026-07-22.prayer: Great Physician, from the earliest of times, you have knelt by us, healed us, and given us hope for better days ahead. Now in humble adoration, we kneel before you, as the healing balm of salvation flows through our hearts. May we always come before you for our healing. Amen.

2026-07-22.daily_watchword: [God] said, “All the people among whom you live shall see the work of the LORD.” Exodus 34:10

2026-07-23.prayer: Compassionate Comforter, when our brothers and sisters cry out to you for help, we know that it will be our hands that will minister to them. We pray that you give us the wisdom to provide for their physical and spiritual needs. Amen.
2026-07-23.doctrinal: And a man lame from birth was being carried in. People would lay him daily at the gate of the temple called the Beautiful Gate so that he could ask for alms from those entering the temple. Acts 3:2
2026-07-23.daily_watchword: I am shut in so that I cannot escape; my eye grows dim through sorrow. Every day I call on you, O LORD. Psalm 88:8-9

2026-07-24.prayer: Dear God, in this moment, quiet our minds as we bask in the wonder of your endless blessings. The most beautiful blessing is the knowledge that we will walk with Christ for eternity. We pray this in the glory of your name. Amen.
2026-07-24.doctrinal: We know that the one who raised Jesus will also raise us with Jesus and will present us with you in his presence. 2 Corinthians 4:14
2026-07-24.daily_watchword: He does great things beyond understanding and marvelous things without number. Job 9:10

2026-07-25.prayer: Great Equalizer, you seek out those most alienated from society: the forgotten, the despised. You make your face shine upon their very existence with justice and mercy. May you teach us to always do the same. Amen.
2026-07-25.doctrinal: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and the God of all consolation. 2 Corinthians 1:3
2026-07-25.daily_watchword: Father of orphans and protector of widows is God in his holy habitation. God gives the desolate a home to live in; he leads out the prisoners to prosperity. Psalm 68:5-6

2026-07-26.prayer: Gentle Dove of peace, we live in a world shaken to its core by wars and acts of violence. Set our hearts upon your ways as we extend an olive branch to all those we meet. We pray this in your restorative name. Amen.
2026-07-26.doctrinal: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God. Matthew 5:9

2026-07-26.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — God, turn to me and be gracious to me, as is your custom toward those who love your name. Psalm 119:132

2026-07-27.prayer: Ever-watchful Savior, whenever we find ourselves unjustly accused in life, whether by other people or life’s circumstances, we find hope in the blessed assurance that you will never let us fall. Thank you for your presence in our lives. Amen.
2026-07-27.doctrinal: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent word to him, “Have nothing to do with that innocent man, for today I have suffered a great deal because of a dream about him.” Matthew 27:19
2026-07-27.daily_watchword: The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, and his ears are open to their cry. Psalm 34:15

2026-07-28.prayer: Blessed Trinity, may all of our songs to you be joyful and full of praise. Whether our song be the sound of our beating heart or our prayers prayed through tears of joy, we look lovingly to you as we lift them up in your presence. Amen.
2026-07-28.doctrinal: Sing and make music from your heart to the Lord. Ephesians 5:19 NIV
2026-07-28.daily_watchword: In God we have boasted continually, and we will give thanks to your name forever. Psalm 44:8

2026-07-29.prayer: O God, many times in life our tears of sorrow become so familiar to us that they feel like an old friend. In those darkest moments, we ask you to enter our hearts with your love and comfort. May we be open to your movement within us. Amen.
2026-07-29.doctrinal: Paul wrote: It has become known throughout the whole imperial guard and to everyone else that my imprisonment is for Christ, and most of the brothers and sisters, having been made confident in the Lord by my imprisonment, dare to speak the word with greater boldness and without fear. Philippians 1:13-14
2026-07-29.daily_watchword: My tears have been my food day and night, while people say to me continually, “Where is your God?” Psalm 42:3

2026-07-30.prayer: God of strength, the race you have set before us is not judged by miles or medals, but instead, through the measure of souls touched by the life- giving promise of your salvation. May we trust in your grace and mercy. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2026-07-30.doctrinal: These are the words of the holy One, the true One: “Because you have kept my word of endurance, I will keep you from the hour of trial.” Revelation 3:7,10
2026-07-30.daily_watchword: The people who are loyal to their God shall stand firm and take action. Daniel 11:32

2026-07-31.prayer: Great I Am, as we walk through life’s trials, hear our prayer. When all seems lost, hear our prayer. When hope springs eternal, hear our prayer. When we can do nothing else but praise your name, hear our prayer. Amen.
2026-07-31.doctrinal: Pray that you may not come into the time of trial. Luke 22:40
2026-07-31.daily_watchword: I will now refine and test them. Jeremiah 9:7

2026-08-01.daily_watchword: You shall not set your desire on your neighbor’s house or anything that belongs to your neighbor. Deuteronomy 5:21 NIV

2026-08-02.prayer: Lord, as foreigners in a strange land, remind us to be mindful of the familiar temptations to serve the gods of false strength, security, and familiarity. Instead, help us follow your generous and compassionate leading. Amen.

2026-08-03.prayer: Lord, you are God over all of us, before all of us, and after all of us. You give life and grace to all your children. Help us to see them as you do, so that our finite separations dissolve into your infinite acceptance. We pray this in your name. Amen.

2026-08-04.daily_watchword: The LORD said, “You have seen what I did to the Egyptians and how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you to myself.” Exodus 19:4

2026-08-05.prayer: God, in the darkness of struggle, in the helplessness of grief, and in the confusion of anger, guide us to your heart and healing. May our faith in you be a security blanket against the coldness of the world. Amen.

2026-08-06.daily_watchword: Those who live at earth’s farthest bounds are awed by your signs. Psalm 65:8

2026-08-07.daily_watchword: Sing aloud, O daughter Zion, shout, O Israel! Rejoice and exult with all your heart, O daughter Jerusalem! The LORD has taken away the judgments against you. Zephaniah 3:14-15

2026-08-08.daily_watchword: You are the God of my salvation; for you I wait all day long. Psalm 25:5

2026-08-09.prayer: Wise Gardener, thank you for continually sowing good and new seeds in this world. Thank you for never giving up on us, your seedlings. May we follow your example of sowing good and new things to make your world, your harvest, more abundant. We pray this in your name. Amen.

2026-08-09.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Jesus spoke to the disciples and said, “Take heart, it is I; do not be afraid.” Matthew 14:27

2026-08-10.daily_watchword: The LORD has established his throne in the heavens, and his kingdom rules over all. Psalm 103:19

2026-08-14.daily_watchword: You have granted me life and steadfast love, and your care has preserved my spirit. Job 10:12

2026-08-15.daily_watchword: O come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the LORD, our Maker! Psalm 95:6

2026-08-16.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you. Psalm 67:5

2026-08-17.daily_watchword: For the LORD loves justice. Psalm 37:28

2026-08-18.daily_watchword: The Lord God has opened my ear, and I was not rebellious; I did not turn backward. Isaiah 50:5

2026-08-19.doctrinal: Therefore you also must be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect. Matthew 24:44
2026-08-19.daily_watchword: For the day of the LORD is coming, it is near. Joel 2:1

2026-08-20.prayer: Creator, how wondrous it is that you, who made all that is, care enough about us to call us your children and choose to dwell among us! Thank you for claiming us and making each of us in your image. Amen.
2026-08-20.doctrinal: But to all who received him, who believed in his name, he gave power to become children of God. John 1:12
2026-08-20.daily_watchword: My dwelling place shall be over them, and I will be their God, and they shall be my people. Ezekiel 37:27

2026-08-21.prayer: Lord, thank you for joy and laughter in our lives! Please increase the joy we share, and open our hearts to share the joy that comes from receiving and sharing your love. Amen.
2026-08-21.doctrinal: Rejoice with an indescribable and glorious joy, for you are receiving the outcome of your faith, the salvation of your souls. 1 Peter 1:8-9
2026-08-21.daily_watchword: So the ransomed of the LORD shall return and come to Zion with rejoicing; everlasting joy shall be upon their heads; they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away. Isaiah 51:11

2026-08-22.doctrinal: From the same mouth comes a blessing and a curse. My brothers and sisters, this ought not to be so. James 3:10
2026-08-22.daily_watchword: My tongue will sing of your promise, for all your commandments are right. Psalm 119:172

2026-08-23.prayer: God, our most reliable provider, many of your children are experiencing hunger and thirst because of the greed of others. As a community of your followers, may we follow your example so that all of your children live in abundance instead of a manufactured wilderness. We pray this in your holy name. Amen.

2026-08-24.daily_watchword: From this time forward I tell you new things, hidden things that you have not known. Isaiah 48:6

2026-08-25.doctrinal: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy may be complete. John 16:24
2026-08-25.daily_watchword: I cry to God Most High, to God who fulfills his purpose for me. Psalm 57:2

2026-08-26.prayer: Lord, this world is a scary place. It can be dangerous business going out our doors. May our faith that your care and support will never leave us, help keep our feet under us as we follow where you lead. Amen.
2026-08-26.doctrinal: I am not asking you to take them out of the world, but I ask you to protect them from the evil one. John 17:15
2026-08-26.daily_watchword: “Because he loves me,” says the LORD, “I will rescue him.” Psalm 91:14 NIV

2026-08-27.daily_watchword: My people shall be satisfied with my bounty, says the LORD. Jeremiah 31:14

2026-08-28.daily_watchword: Plead my cause and redeem me; give me life according to your promise. Psalm 119:154

As the true builder of all things, guide us to trust your design—build our lives upon your rock, that we may praise you now and forever. Amen.
