2026-09-03.prayer: Mighty Savior, who triumphs over death, you are our retreat and our stability. Through Christ, you have conquered darkness and given us eternal victory. Help our hearts to remain steadfast in faith, trusting in your unfailing love. We praise you forever. Amen.
2026-09-03.doctrinal: Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting? But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. 1 Corinthians 15:55,57
2026-09-03.daily_watchword: But my eyes are fixed on you, Sovereign LORD; in you I take refuge—do not give me over to death. Psalm 141:8 NIV

2026-09-04.prayer: Creator God, from dawn to dusk, your name is worthy of all praise. You formed the heavens, the earth, and the waters deep. May our worship rise like the sun, declaring your glory in all creation, now and forever. Amen.
2026-09-04.doctrinal: Worship him, who made heaven and earth, the sea and the springs of water. Revelation 14:7
2026-09-04.daily_watchword: From the rising of the sun to its setting, the name of the LORD is to be praised. Psalm 113:3

2026-09-05.prayer: Lord, strengthen our hearts to remain firm in trials. Let our trust in you be deep and unshakable, not fleeting like shallow roots. Protect those who wait on you, and let deceit not prevail. Keep us faithful and grounded in you. Amen.
2026-09-05.doctrinal: The ones on the rock are those who, when they hear the word, receive it with joy. But these have no root; they believe only for a while and in a time of testing fall away. Luke 8:13
2026-09-05.daily_watchword: Do not let those who wait for you be put to shame; let them be ashamed who are wantonly treacherous. Psalm 25:3

2026-09-06.prayer: Omnipotent Savior, at times we need help to stand firm in the face of opposition. May the peace of your spirit, which you freely give to each of us, guide our faith, so we are not swayed by anxiety or reprimand. Grant us courage to remain steadfast always. Amen.
2026-09-06.doctrinal: God did not give us a spirit of cowardice but rather a spirit of power and of love and of self- discipline. 2 Timothy 1:7
2026-09-06.daily_watchword: Do not fear the reproach of others, and do not be dismayed when they revile you. Isaiah 51:7
2026-09-06.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Give me understanding, O LORD, that I may keep your law and observe it with my whole heart. Psalm 119:34

2026-09-07.prayer: Almighty Healer, you lift us up when we are weary, restoring life with your gentle touch. Speak your word of renewal over us today. Strengthen our steps, awaken our hearts, and fill us with praise. We bless your name, O God. Amen.
2026-09-07.doctrinal: Taking her by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha koum,” which means, “Little girl, get up!” And immediately the girl stood up and began to walk about. Mark 5:41-42
2026-09-07.daily_watchword: I will extol you, O LORD, for you have drawn me up. Psalm 30:1

2026-09-08.prayer: Faithful God, your steadfast love surrounds us, and your grace sustains us each day. We trust in your care and rejoice in your mercy. Bless your saints with your abiding presence, now and forever. In Jesus’ name, we give praise. Amen.
2026-09-08.doctrinal: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with all the saints. Revelation 22:21
2026-09-08.daily_watchword: Steadfast love surrounds those who trust in the LORD. Psalm 32:10

2026-09-09.prayer: Redeeming God, you turn curses into blessings and bring life from death. Through Christ’s sacrifice, we are freed and restored. Fill our hearts with joy and gratitude for your boundless love. May we live in the light of your redemption. Amen.
2026-09-09.doctrinal: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law by becoming a curse for us—for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree.” Galatians 3:13
2026-09-09.daily_watchword: Yet our God turned the curse into a blessing. Nehemiah 13:2

2026-09-10.prayer: Lord, grant us patience and self-control, that we may reflect your peace in all we do. Strengthen our hearts to endure in faith, keeping your commandments with steadfast love. May we serve you humbly, holding fast to Jesus, our guide and strength. Amen.
2026-09-10.doctrinal: Here is a call for the endurance of the saints, those who keep the commandments of God and hold fast to the faith of Jesus. Revelation 14:12
2026-09-10.daily_watchword: One who is slow to anger is better than the mighty, and one whose temper is controlled than one who captures a city. Proverbs 16:32

2026-09-11.prayer: Joyful God, we lift our voices in praise, rejoicing always in your goodness. Like David, may we worship you with all our might, singing and dancing in your presence. Fill our hearts with unshakable joy as we celebrate your endless love. Amen.
2026-09-11.daily_watchword: David and all Israel were dancing before God with all their might, with songs and lyres and harps and tambourines and cymbals and trumpets. 1 Chronicles 13:8

2026-09-12.prayer: Lord, we thank you for the wonders we have seen and the ways you’ve revealed yourself to us. Help us to always remember your faithfulness and proclaim the truth of your resurrection, sharing the joy of seeing the Lord with all we meet. Amen.
2026-09-12.doctrinal: Mary Magdalene went and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord,” and she told them that he had said these things to her. John 20:18
2026-09-12.daily_watchword: But take care and watch yourselves closely, so as neither to forget the things that your eyes have seen. Deuteronomy 4:9

2026-09-13.prayer: Mighty God, our refuge in times of trouble, strengthen us to serve those in need with humble hearts. Let our faith be lived through love, caring for the oppressed and vulnerable, and by reflecting your mercy and justice in all we do. Amen.
2026-09-13.doctrinal: Religion that is pure and undefiled before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their distress. James 1:27
2026-09-13.daily_watchword: The LORD is a stronghold for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of trouble. Psalm 9:9
2026-09-13.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Bless the LORD, O my soul, and do not forget all his benefits. Psalm 103:2

2026-09-14.prayer: Covenant-keeping God, your promises endure for all generations. You call us from near and far, shaping us as your people. Strengthen us to live out your mission with faith and love, sharing your grace and truth in all we do. Amen.
2026-09-14.doctrinal: Peter said to the Israelites, “For the promise is for you, for your children, and for all who are far away, everyone whom the Lord our God calls to him.” Acts 2:39
2026-09-14.daily_watchword: The days are surely coming, says the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah. Jeremiah 31:31

2026-09-15.prayer: Lord, in times of trial, help us to trust in your unwavering strength. May your Holy Spirit speak through us, guiding our words and hearts. Let us rest in your peace, knowing you are our refuge and our steadfast foundation. Amen.
2026-09-15.doctrinal: When they bring you to trial and hand you over, do not worry beforehand about what you are to say, but say whatever is given you at that time, for it is not you who speak but the Holy Spirit. Mark 13:11
2026-09-15.daily_watchword: The LORD will fight for you, and you have only to keep still. Exodus 14:14

2026-09-16.prayer: † During a synodal conference in London, Jesus Christ was recognized as chief elder of the Brethren’s Church. The day is observed as a covenanting day for servants of the church.
2026-09-16.doctrinal: Gracious God, we thank you for the beauty of creation, a reflection of your steadfast love. As we place our hope in you, lead us through the gate of Christ to salvation, trusting in your mercy and eternal care. Amen.
2026-09-16.daily_watchword: I am the gate. Whoever enters by me will be saved. John 10:9
verses: Let your steadfast love, O LORD, be upon us, even as we hope in you. Psalm 33:22

2026-09-17.prayer: Merciful God, in our darkest moments, we cry out to you. Hear our prayers as you heard those of your faithful people. Deliver us from captivity, strengthen our faith, and teach us to trust in your steadfast love. May our thanks be lifted in your name, always. Amen.
2026-09-17.doctrinal: While Peter was kept in prison, the church prayed fervently to God for him. Acts 12:5
2026-09-17.daily_watchword: Bring me out of prison, so that I may give thanks to your name. Psalm 142:7

2026-09-18.prayer: Lord, help us listen closely to your words and remember them in times of trial. Like Peter, when we fail, may we turn to you with repentance. Guide us through our wilderness, and let your grace restore us with hope. Amen.
2026-09-18.doctrinal: Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said: “Before the cock crows, you will deny me three times.” And he went out and wept bitterly. Matthew 26:75
2026-09-18.daily_watchword: Thus shall you say to one another, among yourselves, “What has the LORD answered?” or “What has the LORD spoken?” Jeremiah 23:35

2026-09-19.prayer: Merciful God, your love knows no bounds, and your grace is ever near. When we falter, Christ intercedes for us, bringing forgiveness and peace. Help us trust in your endless mercy and live in the light of your redeeming love. Amen.
2026-09-19.doctrinal: But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous. 1 John 2:1
2026-09-19.daily_watchword: For I will not continually accuse, nor will I always be angry. Isaiah 57:16

2026-09-20.prayer: Mighty God, you are our salvation and our strength. We rejoice in your love and proclaim, “Great is the Lord!” Rescue us from all harm and lead us to your heavenly kingdom. To you be glory forever and ever. Amen.
2026-09-20.doctrinal: The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and save me for his heavenly kingdom. To him be the glory forever and ever. Amen. 2 Timothy 4:18
2026-09-20.daily_watchword: May those who love your salvation say continually, “Great is the LORD!” Psalm 40:16
2026-09-20.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — For to me, living is Christ and dying is gain. Philippians 1:21

2026-09-21.prayer: Gracious Lord, we come with hearts full of gratitude, for you have heard our prayers and shown us your great mercy. May we rejoice together, proclaiming your goodness, and give thanks for your unfailing love. To you be all glory. Amen.
2026-09-21.doctrinal: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown his great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her. Luke 1:58
2026-09-21.daily_watchword: The LORD has granted me the petition that I made to him. 1 Samuel 1:27

2026-09-22.prayer: Generous God, we offer our gifts to you with joyful hearts, knowing that all we have is yours. Help us give freely and willingly, trusting that our offerings will further your kingdom and bring glory to your name. Amen.
2026-09-22.doctrinal: He sold a field that belonged to him, then brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet. Acts 4:37
2026-09-22.daily_watchword: These had given willingly, for with single mind they had offered freely to the LORD. 1 Chronicles 29:9

2026-09-23.prayer: Gracious God, we lift our hearts in gratitude, remembering your countless blessings. Teach us to give thanks in all things, rejoicing in your goodness. May our lives reflect your love and grace, bringing glory to your name forever. Amen.
2026-09-23.doctrinal: Give thanks to God the Father at all times and for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Ephesians 5:20
2026-09-23.daily_watchword: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and do not forget all his benefits. Psalm 103:2

2026-09-24.prayer: Lord of restoration and salvation, renew us by your Spirit and rebuild what is broken. Gather all nations in praise before your throne, that every voice may proclaim your glory. May we stand in unity, rejoicing in your eternal grace. Amen.
2026-09-24.doctrinal: There was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, from all tribes and peoples and languages. They cried out in a loud voice, saying, “Salvation belongs to our God who is seated on the throne and to the Lamb!” Revelation 7:9,10
2026-09-24.daily_watchword: Then the nations that are left all around you shall know that I, the LORD, have rebuilt the ruined places and replanted that which was desolate. Ezekiel 36:36

2026-09-25.prayer: Gracious Lord, our hearts rejoice in you! You are our God, our source of true happiness. Your generosity knows no bounds—it pours blessings upon all who call on you. May we always praise you with joyful hearts and grateful souls. Amen.
2026-09-25.doctrinal: The same Lord is Lord of all and is generous to all who call on him. Romans 10:12
2026-09-25.daily_watchword: Happy are the people whose God is the LORD. Psalm 144:15

2026-09-26.prayer: Lord of all, your reign stretches to the ends of the earth, and your kingdom is our refuge. May your truth be proclaimed to every nation, and may all people recognize your power and love. Be our guide, now and forever. Amen.
2026-09-26.doctrinal: And this good news of the kingdom will be proclaimed throughout the world, as a testimony to all the nations. Matthew 24:14
2026-09-26.daily_watchword: His dominion shall be from sea to sea and from the river to the ends of the earth. Zechariah 9:10

2026-09-27.prayer: Faithful God, you never cast us away but hold us close for your name’s sake. You have made your love known through Christ—let it dwell in us always. Fill our hearts with your light, that we may shine with your grace. Amen.
2026-09-27.doctrinal: Jesus prayed, “I made your name known to them, and I will make it known, so that the love with which you have loved me may be in them and I in them.” John 17:26
2026-09-27.daily_watchword: For the LORD will not cast away his people, for his great name’s sake. 1 Samuel 12:22
2026-09-27.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Let the same mind be in you that was in Christ Jesus. Philippians 2:5

2026-09-28.prayer: Gracious Lord, you have called us and claimed us as your own, binding us to you in steadfast love and mercy. May we walk in righteousness, ever faithful to your will, rejoicing in the grace that chose us first. Amen.
2026-09-28.doctrinal: You did not choose me, but I chose you. John 15:16
2026-09-28.daily_watchword: And I will take you for my wife forever; I will take you for my wife in righteousness and in justice, in steadfast love and in mercy. Hosea 2:19

2026-09-29.prayer: Almighty God, we bless your name forever! All wisdom, power, and glory belong to you. We rejoice in your majesty and give you thanks, for you reign in righteousness. May our hearts forever praise you, now and for all eternity. Amen.
2026-09-29.doctrinal: Amen! Blessing and glory and wisdom and thanksgiving and honor and power and might be to our God forever and ever! Revelation 7:12
2026-09-29.daily_watchword: Blessed be the name of God from age to age, for wisdom and power are his. Daniel 2:20

2026-09-30.prayer: O God, you reveal yourself to all who seek you. Open our hearts to your presence, that we may recognize your voice and proclaim your truth. Fill us with your spirit, that we may follow the anointed one with faith and joy. Amen.
2026-09-30.doctrinal: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (who is called Christ). “When he comes, he will proclaim all things to us.” Jesus said to her, “I am he, the one who is speaking to you.” John 4:25-26
2026-09-30.daily_watchword: If you seek him, he will be found by you. 2 Chronicles 15:2

2026-10-01.prayer: Saving God, we thank you for rescuing us. You save us from the troubles and trials that surround us each and every day. You even save us from ourselves and from our sins. May we continue to find in you peace and rest for our souls. Amen.
2026-10-01.doctrinal: The Lord knows how to rescue the godly from trial. 2 Peter 2:9
2026-10-01.daily_watchword: You who have made me see many troubles and calamities will revive me again. Psalm 71:20

2026-10-02.prayer: Speak to us, Lord. Help us to hear, understand, and live your word. Allow us to build our lives on our strong foundation in Jesus Christ, today and every day. Amen.
2026-10-02.doctrinal: Everyone, then, who hears these words of mine and acts on them will be like a wise man who built his house on rock. Matthew 7:24
2026-10-02.daily_watchword: Speak, LORD, for your servant is listening. 1 Samuel 3:9

2026-10-03.prayer: Creator God, you made us and gave us the ability to love. You formed us and gave us the power to speak. Let the love in our hearts and the words of our mouths bring honor and glory to you. Through Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
2026-10-03.doctrinal: It is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but it is what comes out of the mouth that defiles. Matthew 15:11
2026-10-03.daily_watchword: These people draw near with their mouths and honor me with their lips, while their hearts are far from me. Isaiah 29:13

2026-10-04.prayer: We give glory to you, our God who saves us from our sins! Let all that we say and do be done for your glory as we show our thankfulness to you for all of the great things you do for us. May we unite with our fellow Christians from all over the world around your communion table. Amen.
2026-10-04.doctrinal: So, whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do everything for the glory of God. 1 Corinthians 10:31
2026-10-04.daily_watchword: Stand up and bless the LORD your God from everlasting to everlasting. Blessed be your glorious name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise. Nehemiah 9:5
2026-10-04.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — The stone that the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone. This is the LORD’s doing; it is marvelous in our eyes. Psalm 118:22,23

2026-10-05.prayer: O Lord, our Savior true, give us the courage to ask you for what we need. Give us the faith we need to always place our trust in you. Let your will be done for us. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-05.doctrinal: She said, “Yes, Lord, yet even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.” Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, great is your faith! Let it be done for you as you wish.” Matthew 15:27-28
2026-10-05.daily_watchword: Let me take it upon myself to speak to my lord, I who am but dust and ashes. Genesis 18:27

2026-10-06.prayer: O God, our Savior, we find life in you and from you and through you. Because you live, we live. Help us to share your life and salvation in all that we say and do. Amen.
2026-10-06.doctrinal: Jesus said, “I live, you also will live.” John 14:19
2026-10-06.daily_watchword: Do not let me be put to shame, for I take refuge in you. Psalm 25:20

2026-10-07.prayer: God of justice, as we face the evils of the world that threaten us, give us the strength to overwhelm that evil with the good that comes from you and your love. Let us seek your kingdom every day. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-07.doctrinal: See that none of you repays evil for evil, but always seek to do good to one another and to all. 1 Thessalonians 5:15
2026-10-07.daily_watchword: Seek good and not evil, that you may live. Amos 5:14

2026-10-08.prayer: Lord, give us the patience that we need: patience to wait for you, patience to trust in you, and patience for our souls to be still and know that you are God. Amen.
2026-10-08.doctrinal: The farmer waits for the precious crop from the earth, being patient with it until it receives the early and the late rains. James 5:7
2026-10-08.daily_watchword: For there is still a vision for the appointed time. If it seems to tarry, wait for it. Habakkuk 2:3

2026-10-09.prayer: Gracious Savior, through your life, suffering, death, and resurrection, we are forgiven. Thank you for interceding on our behalf and for removing our sin. In your precious name, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-09.doctrinal: It is Christ who died, or rather, who was raised, who is also at the right hand of God, who also intercedes for us. Romans 8:34
2026-10-09.daily_watchword: It is the Lord God who helps me; who will declare me guilty? Isaiah 50:9

2026-10-10.prayer: Lord of the winds and the seas, help us to know you for who you are. Use the power of your love and grace to quiet the storms that surround us and threaten to sink us. May we find peace and calm in you. Amen.
2026-10-10.doctrinal: They said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?” Mark 4:41
2026-10-10.daily_watchword: Is the LORD’s arm too short? Numbers 11:23 NIV

2026-10-11.prayer: Lord and God, help us to have faith in you. Even though we can’t see you, allow our unbelief to be vanquished by your glory and might. We pray in the name of our crucified and risen Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.
2026-10-11.doctrinal: Thomas answered [Jesus], “My Lord and my God!” John 20:28
2026-10-11.daily_watchword: Gideon said to them, “I will not rule over you, and my son will not rule over you; the LORD will rule over you.” Judges 8:23
2026-10-11.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — O LORD, you are my God; I will exalt you, I will praise your name; for you have done wonderful things. Isaiah 25:1

2026-10-12.prayer: Everlasting God, as we remember all that you have done for us, we see how you have blessed us from generation to generation. May our faith in your mercy be stronger than our fears, so that we may serve you boldly. Amen.
2026-10-12.doctrinal: Mary said, “Indeed, his mercy is for those who fear him from generation to generation.” Luke 1:50
2026-10-12.daily_watchword: I remember the days of old; I think about all your deeds; I meditate on the works of your hands. Psalm 143:5

2026-10-13.prayer: Lord, you call us to follow you. As we answer your call, help us to leave behind everything that gets in the way of fully and faithfully following you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-13.doctrinal: After this he went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax-collection station, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he got up, left everything, and followed him. Luke 5:27-28
2026-10-13.daily_watchword: Therefore we also will serve the LORD, for he is our God. Joshua 24:18

2026-10-14.prayer: Christ Jesus, you invite us to your table—no matter how broken and damaged we feel we are. Give us the courage to invite all, no matter how broken and damaged we may think they are, to join us at your great feast, secure in the knowledge that we will be blessed by your presence among us. In the name of our welcoming savior, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-14.doctrinal: Jesus said, “But when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind. And you will be blessed because they cannot repay you.” Luke 14:13-14
2026-10-14.daily_watchword: Light dawns for the righteous and joy for the upright in heart. Psalm 97:11

2026-10-15.prayer: Lord, we thank you for entering our world and our lives. Let us continue to hear your knock on our door so that we may open it to allow you in. May we join you, gracious Savior, at the table you set before us, to quench our thirsty souls and fill our lives with good gifts. Amen.
2026-10-15.doctrinal: Listen! I am standing at the door, knocking; if you hear my voice and open the door, I will come in and eat with you, and you with me. Revelation 3:20
2026-10-15.daily_watchword: The LORD is good to those who wait for him, to the soul that seeks him. Lamentations 3:25

2026-10-16.prayer: God of salvation, you are the place where love and faithfulness meet. In you and your love, righteousness and peace kiss each other. Fill our hearts with your love and faithfulness. Fill our lives with your righteousness and peace. Through Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
2026-10-16.doctrinal: The fruit of the light is found in all that is good and right and true. Ephesians 5:9
2026-10-16.daily_watchword: Surely his salvation is at hand for those who fear him. Steadfast love and faithfulness will meet; righteousness and peace will kiss each other. Psalm 85:9,10

2026-10-17.prayer: Lord God, we are bearing heavy burdens. Give us the strength we need to help one another carry the weight, so that we may fulfill Christ’s law as we seek to give you all praise and glory. Amen.
2026-10-17.doctrinal: Bear one another’s burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ. Galatians 6:2
2026-10-17.daily_watchword: Do what is just and right. Rescue from the hand of the oppressor the one who has been robbed. Do no wrong or violence to the foreigner, the fatherless or the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place. Jeremiah 22:3 NIV

2026-10-18.prayer: Lord God of hosts, make our churches and homes be houses of prayer. As we offer you our prayers and praises, may we prosper in faith, hope, and love. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-18.doctrinal: He [Jesus] was teaching and said, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations?’” Mark 11:17
2026-10-18.daily_watchword: In this place I will give prosperity, says the LORD of hosts. Haggai 2:9
2026-10-18.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Sing to the LORD, bless his name; tell of his salvation from day to day. Psalm 96:2

2026-10-19.prayer: Almighty King, give us the messages of your love and mercy that you want us to share with the world. Empower us always to be persistent in taking your message to the very ends of the earth. In the blessed name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-19.doctrinal: Proclaim the message; be persistent whether the time is favorable or unfavorable; convince, rebuke, and encourage with the utmost patience in teaching. 2 Timothy 4:2
2026-10-19.daily_watchword: For the lips of a priest should guard knowledge, and people should seek instruction from his mouth, for he is the messenger of the LORD of hosts. Malachi 2:7

2026-10-20.prayer: God, we know you and you call us to proclaim your message to every people, tongue, and nation. Give us the words we need to speak your love throughout all the world, so that there will be no more offerings given to an unknown god. Amen.
2026-10-20.doctrinal: Paul said, “For as I went through the city and looked carefully at the objects of your worship, I found among them an altar with the inscription, ‘To an unknown god.’ What therefore you worship as unknown, this I proclaim to you.” Acts 17:23
2026-10-20.daily_watchword: They have made for themselves gods of gold. But now, if you will only forgive their sin. Exodus 32:31-32

2026-10-21.prayer: Jesus, you are our daily bread. Allow us to feast and live on your word and your truth each and every day of our lives, until you call us into the heavenly place above. We pray in our savior’s name. Amen.
2026-10-21.doctrinal: Give us today our daily bread. Matthew 6:11
2026-10-21.daily_watchword: The LORD will guide you continually and satisfy your needs in parched places. Isaiah 58:11

2026-10-22.prayer: Good Shepherd, you made us and we are yours. You know us and you call us by name. Help us to know you so that we may assist you in bringing your lost sheep home. Amen.
2026-10-22.doctrinal: I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and my own know me. John 10:14
2026-10-22.daily_watchword: It is he who made us, and we are his; we are his people and the sheep of his pasture. Psalm 100:3

2026-10-23.prayer: Morning Star of our faith and life, you came and fulfilled the words of the prophets. As you now reign in highest heaven, continue to deal with us wisely and execute justice and righteousness in our land. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-23.doctrinal: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.” Matthew 16:16
2026-10-23.daily_watchword: The days are surely coming, says the LORD, when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and he shall reign as king and deal wisely and shall execute justice and righteousness in the land. Jeremiah 23:5

2026-10-24.prayer: God of unity, give us courage to look at our fellow citizens, not as foreigners or strangers, but as our brothers and sisters, so that we can unite in your household. Let all of the earth see your salvation in us and through us. We pray as one. Amen.
2026-10-24.doctrinal: Consequently, you are no longer foreigners and strangers, but fellow citizens with God’s people and also members of his household. Ephesians 2:19 NIV
2026-10-24.daily_watchword: The LORD has bared his holy arm before the eyes of all the nations, and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God. Isaiah 52:10

2026-10-25.prayer: Gracious God, you show us your love in the life, sufferings, death, and resurrection of your son. Thank you for rescuing us from the power of darkness and bringing us safely to the light of your kingdom. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-25.doctrinal: He has rescued us from the power of darkness and transferred us into the kingdom of his beloved son. Colossians 1:13
2026-10-25.daily_watchword: Because your steadfast love is better than life. Psalm 63:3
2026-10-25.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — You shall be holy, for I the LORD your God am holy. Leviticus 19:2

2026-10-26.prayer: Kind God and loving Savior, lead us to repent our sins. We know that we fall short of your glory. We know that we too often fail to live as who we truly are, your beloved children. Forgive us, we pray. Amen.
2026-10-26.doctrinal: Do you not realize that God’s kindness is meant to lead you to repentance? Romans 2:4
2026-10-26.daily_watchword: But of you I will not make an end. I will chastise you in just measure, and I will by no means leave you unpunished. Jeremiah 30:11

2026-10-27.prayer: Savior, let us follow your example to show no partiality. Keep us bound together with cords that cannot be broken. Bind us together with all our brothers and sisters in Christ in the great fellowship of your love. Amen.
2026-10-27.doctrinal: Then Peter began to speak to them: “I truly understand that God shows no partiality, but in every people anyone who fears him and practices righteousness is acceptable to him.” Acts 10:34-35
2026-10-27.daily_watchword: Rise up, O God, judge the earth, for all the nations belong to you! Psalm 82:8

2026-10-28.prayer: Living Savior, you are with us today, and you can set us free from our ailments. Place your hands of mercy upon us and heal us so that we may stand up straight and praise you. Amen.
2026-10-28.doctrinal: When Jesus saw her, he called her over and said, “Woman, you are set free from your ailment.” When he laid his hands on her, immediately she stood up straight and began praising God. Luke 13:12-13
2026-10-28.daily_watchword: Bless the LORD, who redeems your life from the Pit, who crowns you with steadfast love and mercy. Psalm 103:2,4

2026-10-29.prayer: Lord Jesus, you call us just as you called Simon and Andrew to follow you. Fill us with the courage that they showed and allow us to leave behind everything that is holding us back from following you. This world is full of people who need to know you. Help us to find them and bring them to you. Amen.
2026-10-29.doctrinal: And Jesus said to Simon and Andrew, “Follow me, and I will make you fishers of people.” Mark 1:17
2026-10-29.daily_watchword: Samuel said to Saul, “Stop here yourself for a while, that I may make known to you the word of God.” 1 Samuel 9:27

2026-10-30.prayer: Prince of peace, may this and every generation magnify you by sharing your love, your grace, and your mercy to the ends of the earth. As we have received the gift of salvation through you, may we never ignore our call to share you with others. Amen.
2026-10-30.doctrinal: And Mary said, “My soul magnifies the Lord, and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior, for he has looked with favor on the lowly state of his servant.” Luke 1:46-48
2026-10-30.daily_watchword: He raises up the poor from the dust. 1 Samuel 2:8

2026-10-31.prayer: We praise you, Lord! We praise you! For our pardon, we praise you. For our redemption, we praise you. For the gift of your grace in Jesus Christ, we praise you! Amen.
2026-10-31.doctrinal: They are now justified by his grace as a gift, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus. Romans 3:24
2026-10-31.daily_watchword: Treasures gained by wickedness do not profit, but righteousness delivers from death. Proverbs 10:2

2026-11-01.prayer: Great and gracious One, on this day, we remember your saints from all corners of the globe. Help us live lives that honor their deeds, sacrifices, and love for you as your witnesses in the world. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-01.doctrinal: You will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth. Acts 1:8
2026-11-01.daily_watchword: For now he shall be great to the ends of the earth. Micah 5:4
2026-11-01.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — O send out your light and your truth; let them lead me. Psalm 43:3
special_remarks: Watchword for All Saints Day — Salvation belongs to our God who is seated on the throne, and to the Lamb! Revelation 7:10

2026-11-02.prayer: Merciful Judge, you know our faults and foibles, yet love us without fail. Lead us in ways that help us live lives of goodness and service, so that when we face that final judgement day, we will be deemed worthy to join you in heaven. Amen.
2026-11-02.doctrinal: Because he has fixed a day on which he will have the world judged in righteousness by a man whom he has appointed, and of this he has given assurance to all by raising him from the dead. Acts 17:31
2026-11-02.daily_watchword: The LORD judges the peoples. Psalm 7:8

2026-11-03.prayer: Everlasting Creator, thank you for the glorious world that you brought into being. Each day, help us recognize the beauty around us, and teach us to care for all that comes from you. In your loving name, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-03.doctrinal: For from him and through him and to him are all things. To him be the glory forever. Amen. Romans 11:36
2026-11-03.daily_watchword: Have you not known? Have you not heard? The LORD is the everlasting God, the Creator of the ends of the earth. He does not faint or grow weary; his understanding is unsearchable. Isaiah 40:28

2026-11-04.prayer: Loving Comforter, thank you for being the source of joy in this troubled world. Although our lives know pain and discomfort, we live in the hope of seeing you again, when the hurts of today will be erased by the joy of eternity with you. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-04.doctrinal: So you have pain now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you. John 16:22
2026-11-04.daily_watchword: The LORD will again comfort Zion. Zechariah 1:17

2026-11-05.prayer: Guarding Shepherd, your flock knows the strength and love you provide. Your steadfast presence brings us sustenance and hope, even when we go astray. Feed and protect us, so we may do the same to help the hungry around us. Amen.
2026-11-05.doctrinal: No one will snatch them out of my hand. John 10:28
2026-11-05.daily_watchword: And he shall stand and feed his flock in the strength of the LORD. Micah 5:4

2026-11-06.prayer: Generous Provider, we hunger for more than food for our bellies. We long to be filled with your love, to taste your forgiveness, and to share in your bounty, while heeding your call to feed your sheep. Feed us, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-06.doctrinal: For I was hungry and you gave me food. Matthew 25:35
2026-11-06.daily_watchword: Share your bread with the hungry. Isaiah 58:7

2026-11-07.prayer: Lord, wind and fire and earthquake can bring devastation and loss. But your words and actions, when likened to wind and flame and tremor, help us understand the greatness of your power and know of your creating strength. Amen.
2026-11-07.doctrinal: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord, descending from heaven, came and rolled back the stone and sat on it. Matthew 28:2
2026-11-07.daily_watchword: You make the winds your messengers, fire and flame your ministers. Psalm 104:4

2026-11-08.prayer: Unifying Spirit, we live in a world filled with strife, separation, and discontent. We long for peace and tranquility. Help us to join your followers from many faiths and traditions to work for the unity and peace we long for through you. Amen.
2026-11-08.doctrinal: Make every effort to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace. Ephesians 4:3
2026-11-08.daily_watchword: Then Abram said to Lot, “Let there be no strife between you and me and between your herders and my herders, for we are kindred.” Genesis 13:8
2026-11-08.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Keep awake therefore, for you know neither the day nor the hour. Matthew 25:13

2026-11-09.prayer: Forgiving God, you know the depths of our hearts and souls. We are imperfect beings; you see our sins, secret to ourselves and hidden from others, yet your light shines through to brighten the path to you. May we always choose the light. Amen.
2026-11-09.doctrinal: Whenever our hearts condemn us, for God is greater than our hearts, and he knows everything. 1 John 3:20
2026-11-09.daily_watchword: You have set our iniquities before you, our secret sins in the light of your countenance. Psalm 90:8

2026-11-10.prayer: Protecting Spirit, some days find us concerned with the weights of the world—disasters, politics, war, and suffering. Yet with our faith in you, we can face those weights with courage and strength, knowing that your spirit is there to guide us, protect us and fill us with joy. Amen.
2026-11-10.doctrinal: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit. Acts 13:52
2026-11-10.daily_watchword: Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the LORD. Psalm 31:24

2026-11-11.prayer: Listening God, our hearts are ever searching and hopeful. We come to you each day with our prayers and supplications as your word invites us to ask, seek, knock, and look to you. Hear us, guide us, teach us, and open the door to your power and love. Amen.
2026-11-11.doctrinal: For everyone who asks receives, and everyone who searches finds, and for everyone who knocks, the door will be opened. Matthew 7:8
2026-11-11.daily_watchword: But as for me, I will look to the LORD; I will wait for the God of my salvation; my God will hear me. Micah 7:7

2026-11-12.prayer: Heavenly Host, thank you for the gift of your word each day. Teach us the ways of forgiveness, care, reconciliation, and hope. Prepare our hearts for worship and invite our brothers and sisters into your house so that we may praise your goodness and love together. With hope, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-12.doctrinal: First be reconciled to your brother or sister, and then come and offer your gift. Matthew 5:24
2026-11-12.daily_watchword: Guard your steps when you go to the house of God; to draw near to listen is better. Ecclesiastes 5:1

2026-11-13.prayer: † On this day, in 1741, it was announced in all Moravian congregations that Jesus Christ had been chosen Chief Elder of the Moravian Church. The Moravian Church has had no single human chief executive since then, and now observes this as a festival day.
2026-11-13.doctrinal: Chief Elder, on this day nearly three centuries ago, our forebears saw the wisdom of naming you as the head of our church. We look to your leadership to guide us as we share your good news throughout the world. We pray that we can remain worthy to be your disciples forever. Amen.
2026-11-13.daily_watchword: He [Jesus] said to them, “Why were you searching for me? Did you not know that I must be in my Father’s house?” Luke 2:49
verses: Your eyes may be open night and day toward this house, the place of which you said, “My name shall be there.” 1 Kings 8:29

2026-11-14.prayer: Living God, many generations of believers have brought us to this day. Thank you for sending us your son and for filling our ancestors with your love and hope, so that they could teach us your ways and bring us to you. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-14.doctrinal: And we bring you the good news that what God promised to our ancestors he has fulfilled for us, their children, by raising Jesus. Acts 13:32-33
2026-11-14.daily_watchword: The LORD our God be with us, as he was with our ancestors. 1 Kings 8:57

2026-11-15.prayer: Heavenly Light, we know there is darkness and evil in this world. We see sadness, hopelessness, anger, deceit, and pain all around us. Yet, our faith in you can erase our fear and despair. We are forever grateful for the hope, love, and outstretched arms you offer. We praise you for your protective spirit. Amen.
2026-11-15.doctrinal: The gates of Hades will not prevail against it. Matthew 16:18
2026-11-15.daily_watchword: They shall live in safety, and no one shall make them afraid. Ezekiel 34:28
2026-11-15.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — So teach us, O LORD, to count our days that we may gain a wise heart. Psalm 90:12

2026-11-16.prayer: Glorious King, you reign supreme above all. We hear your voice in the cry of a newborn, the laughter of a child, the song of youth, and the stories of elders. Help us, your followers, to share that voice and the love it brings throughout the world. Amen.
2026-11-16.doctrinal: Then he said, “The God of our ancestors has chosen you to know his will, to see the righteous one, and to hear his own voice, for you will be his witness to all the world of what you have seen and heard.” Acts 22:14-15
2026-11-16.daily_watchword: Who would not fear you, O King of the nations? For that is your due. Jeremiah 10:7

2026-11-17.prayer: Lamb of God, you take away the sins of the world. Happy are we who are called to your table. You help us bear our burdens, you forgive our sins, you make us whole. May we prove worthy of your sacrifice that offers us all the chance for salvation. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-17.doctrinal: The next day he saw Jesus coming toward him and declared, “Here is the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!” John 1:29
2026-11-17.daily_watchword: He bore the sin of many and made intercession for the transgressors. Isaiah 53:12

2026-11-18.prayer: Forgiving God, we are sinners. In ways large and small, we stray from your path. Yet, with contrition and confession, we bare our souls and seek your forgiveness. Be our strength as we seek to live righteous, helpful, fruitful, and holy lives. Amen.
2026-11-18.doctrinal: Therefore, I tell you, her many sins have been forgiven; hence she has shown great love. But the one to whom little is forgiven loves little. Luke 7:47
2026-11-18.daily_watchword: I love you, O LORD, my strength. Psalm 18:1

2026-11-19.prayer: Merciful Parent, cleanse us and bring us close. In faith, we see your power to lift us. In love, we see the great gift of your son. In hope, we long to be yours. We are your people; bless us and welcome us into your family. Amen.
2026-11-19.doctrinal: But God, who is rich in mercy, out of the great love with which he loved us even when we were dead through our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ. Ephesians 2:4-5
2026-11-19.daily_watchword: I will save them from all the apostasies into which they have fallen and will cleanse them. Then they shall be my people. Ezekiel 37:23

2026-11-20.prayer: Heavenly Teacher, thank you for your words that give us the strength of faith. Send us into the world to speak your truth, to share your hope and lift up those who need your love. Through you, we can strengthen all the world. Amen.
2026-11-20.doctrinal: Jesus said to Simon Peter, “I have prayed for you that your own faith may not fail, and you, when once you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.” Luke 22:32
2026-11-20.daily_watchword: Now go, and I will be with your mouth and teach you what you are to speak. Exodus 4:12

2026-11-21.prayer: Inspiring God, you bring life and vibrancy to your people. Through your word, we learn your ways, your instruction and your hopes for us. May we hear your voice every day, take comfort in its loving power, and use it to guide our work in this world. Amen.
2026-11-21.doctrinal: Indeed, the word of God is living and active and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing until it divides soul from spirit, joints from marrow; it is able to judge the thoughts and intentions of the heart. Hebrews 4:12
2026-11-21.daily_watchword: It shall not return to me empty, but it shall accomplish that which I purpose and succeed in the thing for which I sent it. Isaiah 55:11

2026-11-22.prayer: Lamb of God, today we celebrate your lordship over all. As we prepare for the season of Advent, fill our hearts with the spirit of life, and nurture our faith with love. Help us take your word into the world to bear fruit for your kin(g)dom. Amen.
2026-11-22.doctrinal: But as for that in the good soil, these are the ones who, when they hear the word, hold it fast in an honest and good heart and bear fruit with endurance. Luke 8:15
2026-11-22.daily_watchword: For as the rain and the snow come down from heaven and do not return there until they have watered the earth, making it bring forth and sprout, giving seed to the sower and bread to the eater, so shall my word be that goes out from my mouth. Isaiah 55:10-11
2026-11-22.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — God says, “I will seek the lost, and I will bring back the strayed, and I will bind up the injured, and I will strengthen the weak.” Ezekiel 34:16

2026-11-23.prayer: Creator God, the beauty of this world inspires us to follow the one who made it all. Give us the strength and will to protect our planet and all that you created. Give us voices to praise you, the source of creation’s abundance. Amen.
2026-11-23.doctrinal: Then I heard every creature in heaven and on earth and under the earth and in the sea and all that is in them, singing, “To the one seated on the throne and to the Lamb be blessing and honor and glory and might forever and ever!” Revelation 5:13
2026-11-23.daily_watchword: And Ezra said, “You are the LORD, you alone; you have made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their host, the earth and all that is on it, the seas and all that is in them.” Nehemiah 9:6

2026-11-24.prayer: Forgiving God, we know our world is filled with evil, anger, and strife. Pointing fingers, raised voices, uncaring deeds, and thoughtless hate surround us. Yet, by following your call to turn away from anger, may we bless our persecutors and work for peace. Help us work for a world filled with faith, love, and hope. Amen.
2026-11-24.doctrinal: Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse them. Romans 12:14
2026-11-24.daily_watchword: You shall not follow a majority in wrongdoing. Exodus 23:2

2026-11-25.prayer: Loving God, you teach us that love is your greatest commandment. Too often we overlook the power of love that can heal our broken world. Help us to always keep love in our hearts and share its awesome power with friend, stranger, and enemy alike. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-25.doctrinal: This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you. John 15:12
2026-11-25.daily_watchword: I shall walk at liberty, for I have sought your precepts. Psalm 119:45

2026-11-26.prayer: Patient Sustainer, too often our pride can close our eyes and cover our ears to signs of your love. Help us to set that pride aside, opening us to recognize your still, strong voice and guidance. We will humbly walk with you, giving you thanks and praising your name. Amen.
2026-11-26.doctrinal: Continue to walk in him, abounding in thanksgiving. Colossians 2:6-7
2026-11-26.daily_watchword: In those days Hezekiah became sick and was at the point of death. He prayed to the LORD, and he answered him and gave him a sign. But Hezekiah did not respond according to the benefit done to him, for his heart was proud. 2 Chronicles 32:24-25

2026-11-27.prayer: Brightest Lamp, your light is the beacon by which we see the beauty of our lives. Thank you for always shining your light on us, expelling the darkness and giving us hope. May we carry your brightness in our hearts and share it with the world. Amen.
2026-11-27.doctrinal: In him was life, and the life was the light of all people. John 1:4
2026-11-27.daily_watchword: Indeed, you are my lamp, O LORD; the LORD lightens my darkness. 2 Samuel 22:29

2026-11-28.prayer: Loving God, we know all glory and honor is yours. Help us as we strive to be your messengers of peace, your deliverers of good news and your preachers of salvation. We sing of your glory in the highest heaven, and hope for the peace that your glory brings. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-28.doctrinal: Glory to God in the highest heaven, and on earth peace among those whom he favors! Luke 2:14
2026-11-28.daily_watchword: How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of the messenger who announces peace, who brings good news, who announces salvation, who says to Zion, “Your God reigns.” Isaiah 52:7

2026-11-29.prayer: Redeeming God, we feel your guiding hand strengthening us as we journey through this bright season of Advent. Show us the way to encourage all to prepare for your coming, and give us the tools to build up your kingdom here on earth. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2026-11-29.doctrinal: Therefore encourage one another and build up each other, as indeed you are doing. 1 Thessalonians 5:11
2026-11-29.daily_watchword: Saul’s son Jonathan set out and came to David at Horesh; there he strengthened his hand through the LORD. 1 Samuel 23:16
2026-11-29.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Then they will see “the Son of Man coming in clouds” with great power and glory. Mark 13:26

2026-11-30.prayer: Forgiving God, how often we let the ways of the world blind us to your constant presence and love. We allow ourselves to wander in darkness, when all we need to do is allow your bright morning star to rise in our hearts. We turn to you this day with open eyes, open hearts, and open arms. Amen.
2026-11-30.doctrinal: So we have the prophetic message more fully confirmed. You will do well to be attentive to this as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day dawns and the morning star rises in your hearts. 2 Peter 1:19
2026-11-30.daily_watchword: Even the stork in the heavens knows its times, and the turtledove, swallow, and crane observe the time of their coming, but my people do not know the ordinance of the LORD. Jeremiah 8:7

2026-12-01.prayer: Father, Abba, we appreciate your steadfast commitment to our well-being. As we move through the world, may we not be swayed by its temptations. Instead, may we return to you. We are thankful for your unconditional love. We love you; we praise you; we glorify you, Lord. Amen.
2026-12-01.doctrinal: Just so, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents. Luke 15:10
2026-12-01.daily_watchword: Return, O faithless children, I will heal your faithlessness. “Here we come to you, for you are the LORD our God.” Jeremiah 3:22

2026-12-02.prayer: Dear heavenly God, we appreciate your invitation to salvation. Please help us to stay focused on you and your will, and may we never lose the site of your guidance. May your soft voice always resonate within us. We are thankful for all your blessings and the gift of salvation you offer us. Amen.
2026-12-02.doctrinal: Therefore we must pay greater attention to what we have heard, so that we do not drift away. Hebrews 2:1
2026-12-02.daily_watchword: Incline your ear, and come to me; listen, so that you may live. Isaiah 55:3

2026-12-03.prayer: King of kings, we come before you to give you thanks for your thankfulness. You are our lord; we trust in you. You are always present with us, in every step we take. May we always trust your directions. Thank you. Amen.
2026-12-03.doctrinal: Abraham was fully convinced that God was able to do what he had promised. Romans 4:21
2026-12-03.daily_watchword: I formed you, you are my servant; O Israel, do not forget me. Isaiah 44:21

2026-12-04.prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to you with hope and faith, seeking your intervention in our lives. When struggling with mental or physical darkness, we humbly request that you deliver us into your radiant light of love. Thank you, infinite Power, for your compassion. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-04.doctrinal: Because of the tender mercy of our God, the dawn from on high will break upon us, to shine upon those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace. Luke 1:78-79
2026-12-04.daily_watchword: Some sat in darkness and in gloom, prisoners in misery and in irons. Then they cried to the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them from their distress; let them thank the LORD for his steadfast love, for his wonderful works to humankind. Psalm 107:10,13,15

2026-12-05.prayer: Eternal God, we praise your holy name. We are grateful that you are consistent, that you never change who you are. We are grateful beyond measure for your sacrifices. Amen.
2026-12-05.doctrinal: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever. Hebrews 13:8
2026-12-05.daily_watchword: I am the first, and I am the last; besides me there is no god. Isaiah 44:6

2026-12-06.prayer: Eternal Three-in-One, we celebrate your sacred presence. Guide us on life’s journey until you return. We pray for peace to prevail over darkness, and for love to transform our world. We pray in the name of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. Amen.
2026-12-06.doctrinal: Give thanks to the Father, who has enabled you to share in the inheritance of the saints in the light. Colossians 1:12
2026-12-06.daily_watchword: Those who bring thanksgiving as their sacrifice honor me; to those who go the right way, I will show the salvation of God. Psalm 50:23
2026-12-06.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — He will feed his flock like a shepherd; he will gather the lambs in his arms, and carry them in his bosom. Isaiah 40:11

2026-12-07.prayer: Omnipotent Creator of everything, infinitely wise and powerful, we eagerly anticipate the day when we will be fully revealed as your children, united with you forever. Amen.
2026-12-07.doctrinal: The creation itself will be set free from its enslavement to decay and will obtain the freedom of the glory of the children of God. Romans 8:21
2026-12-07.daily_watchword: In his hand are the depths of the earth; the heights of the mountains are his also. Psalm 95:4

2026-12-08.prayer: Dear God, we come before you with hearts filled with profound joy and deep gratitude. May our lives serve as a testament to our unwavering devotion. May we present ourselves as a living sacrifice, worthy of your presence, as we humbly worship you. Amen.
2026-12-08.doctrinal: Present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable to God, which is your reasonable act of worship. Romans 12:1
2026-12-08.daily_watchword: Sing to the LORD; bless his name; tell of his salvation from day to day. Psalm 96:2

2026-12-09.prayer: Lord God, may we flourish in you, and always be willing to fulfill your divine purpose. Your peace and prosperity direct our lives; may we always acknowledge your omnipotence and our dependence on you. Make our lives abundantly fruitful, for without you, we are nothing. Amen.
2026-12-09.doctrinal: Abide in me as I abide in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit by itself unless it abides in the vine, neither can you unless you abide in me. John 15:4
2026-12-09.daily_watchword: They are like trees planted by streams of water, which yield their fruit in its season, and their leaves do not wither. Psalm 1:3

2026-12-10.prayer: Dear Lord, may our hearts overflow with joy and gratitude as we celebrate your infinite love and transformative power. We rejoice in the triumphs of answered prayers and honor your majesty. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-10.doctrinal: Surely from now on all generations will call me blessed, for the Mighty One has done great things for me, and holy is his name. Luke 1:48-49
2026-12-10.daily_watchword: Come and hear, all you who fear God, and I will tell what he has done for me. Psalm 66:16

2026-12-11.prayer: Lord God, we humbly come before you seeking guidance and wisdom. Please be with us, for you know our deepest desires. Teach us to lead a righteous life, so when the time comes to stand before your throne, we will be deemed worthy. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-11.doctrinal: And before him no creature is hidden, but all are naked and laid bare to the eyes of the one to whom we must render an account. Hebrews 4:13
2026-12-11.daily_watchword: Even before a word is on my tongue, O LORD, you know it completely. Psalm 139:4

2026-12-12.prayer: Almighty God, we ask that you be with us always. We seek your divine protection to empower us with courage and strength. May your presence be our guiding light to help us rise above life’s challenges. Amen.
2026-12-12.doctrinal: They are Israelites, and to them belong the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the worship, and the promises. Romans 9:4
2026-12-12.daily_watchword: Spare your people, O LORD, and do not make your heritage a mockery. Joel 2:17

2026-12-13.prayer: Lord our God, when we are faced with worldly temptations, empower us to discern the difference between temporary pleasures and eternal life. May our hearts stay focused on the promise of eternity, and may we remain faithful to your will. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-13.doctrinal: And the world and its desire are passing away, but those who do the will of God abide forever. 1 John 2:17
2026-12-13.daily_watchword: She took of its fruit and ate, and she also gave some to her husband, who was with her, and he ate. Genesis 3:6
2026-12-13.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — May the God of peace sanctify you entirely; and may your spirit and soul and body be kept sound and blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. 1 Thessalonians 5:23

2026-12-14.prayer: Creator God, please protect us from the influence of deceit. Grant us the strength to remain faithful to you. Guide us along the right path; shield us from false teachings that seek to lead us astray. Direct our steps and enable us to stay focused on you, our lord, without wavering. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-14.doctrinal: And [Jesus] said, “Beware that you are not led astray, for many will come in my name and say, ‘I am he!’ and ‘The time is near!’ Do not go after them.” Luke 21:8
2026-12-14.daily_watchword: Alas for the senseless prophets who follow their own spirit and have seen nothing! Ezekiel 13:3

2026-12-15.prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before you. Forgive our sins, purify our hearts, and lead us towards goodness. Help us to forgive one another and become better people. Through Jesus Christ, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-15.doctrinal: And forgive us our sins, for we ourselves forgive everyone indebted to us. Luke 11:4
2026-12-15.daily_watchword: O Jerusalem, wash your heart clean of wickedness so that you may be saved. How long shall your evil schemes lodge within you? Jeremiah 4:14

2026-12-16.prayer: Eternal Father, inspire us to live in harmony, united by love, compassion, and understanding. May your presence encourage us to uplift others. Fill our hearts with joy, and guide us to a better tomorrow. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-16.doctrinal: Finally, brothers and sisters, farewell. Be restored; listen to my appeal; agree with one another; live in peace. 2 Corinthians 13:11
2026-12-16.daily_watchword: You shall not hate in your heart anyone of your kin; you shall reprove your neighbor, or you will incur guilt yourself. Leviticus 19:17

2026-12-17.prayer: Dear God, may your words fill us with the hope and the courage that comes from your guidance. Teach us to live with joy, gratitude, and strength. May the wisdom you’ve given us be a guiding light on our path. Thank you, Lord. Amen.
2026-12-17.doctrinal: For whatever was written in former days was written for our instruction, so that by steadfastness and by the encouragement of the scriptures we might have hope. Romans 15:4
2026-12-17.daily_watchword: Though I write for him the multitude of my instructions, they are regarded as a strange thing. Hosea 8:12

2026-12-18.prayer: Lord, hear our cry! When we come to you, we come as we are trusting your love will transform us. Take us in our brokenness, heal our hearts, and make us complete. Thank you, Lord! In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-18.doctrinal: Great crowds came to him, bringing with them the lame, the blind, the maimed, the mute, and many others. They put them at his feet, and he cured them. Matthew 15:30
2026-12-18.daily_watchword: Out of the depths I cry to you, O LORD. Lord, hear my voice! Psalm 130:1-2

2026-12-19.prayer: Supreme God, with reverence and hope, we stand before you, acknowledging your great love and power that motivates us daily. We trust that with your wisdom, we can achieve all things. Thank you, Lord. Amen.
2026-12-19.doctrinal: For nothing will be impossible with God. Luke 1:37
2026-12-19.daily_watchword: There is none like you, O LORD; you are great, and your name is great in might. Jeremiah 10:6

2026-12-20.prayer: Most High, may your boundless love surround us always and your watchful care keep us safe. May we walk in the beauty of your newness, filled with joy, peace, and hope. We honor your holy name, Lord. Amen.
2026-12-20.doctrinal: The nations will walk by its light, and the kings of the earth will bring their glory into it. Revelation 21:24
2026-12-20.daily_watchword: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, the holy habitation of the Most High. God is in the midst of the city; it shall not be moved. Psalm 46:4-5
2026-12-20.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — The Mighty One has done great things for me, and holy is his name. Luke 1:49

2026-12-21.prayer: Redeeming Lord and God, may your presence uplift us to overcome life’s struggles. May we emerge stronger, our hearts and souls renewed, and when our time on this earth comes to a close, be with us, Lord. Amen.
2026-12-21.doctrinal: While they were stoning Stephen, he prayed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.” Acts 7:59
2026-12-21.daily_watchword: You have taken up my cause, O Lord; you have redeemed my life. Lamentations 3:58

2026-12-22.prayer: Lord, we offer our heartfelt thanks for sending us your son, Jesus, our Lord. We are thankful for the blessings you have bestowed upon our children and families. With grateful hearts, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-22.doctrinal: Elizabeth exclaimed with a loud cry, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb.” Luke 1:42
2026-12-22.daily_watchword: May the LORD give you increase, both you and your children. Psalm 115:14

2026-12-23.prayer: Creator of all people, may we always remember that we are equally loved by you. Help us to always love each other, and respect one another. Remind us that we are created in your own image. Thank you, God. Amen.
2026-12-23.doctrinal: Nevertheless, in the Lord woman is not independent of man or man independent of woman. For just as woman came from man, so man comes through woman, but all things come from God. 1 Corinthians 11:11-12
2026-12-23.daily_watchword: So God created humans in his image, in the image of God he created them; male and female he created them. Genesis 1:27

2026-12-24.prayer: Divine One, we honor your profound presence on this glorious night. Your majesty and power fill our hearts with hope and awe. We are grateful for the precious gift of your beloved son, who brings light to this world. May all glory and honor be yours, on this silent night and throughout every day of our lives. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-24.doctrinal: And we have seen and do testify that the Father has sent his Son as the Savior of the world. 1 John 4:14
2026-12-24.daily_watchword: O LORD, you are our God; let no mortal prevail against you. 2 Chronicles 14:11

2026-12-25.prayer: Father, on this special day, we come before you to express our deepest gratitude for the gift of your word, a love letter of immense significance to humanity. Your deep love for us is demonstrated through the provision of your word of instruction for living our lives. We our grateful for our Lord Jesus, who brings light to our world. Amen.
2026-12-25.doctrinal: When the angels had left them and gone into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let us go now to Bethlehem and see this thing that has taken place, which the Lord has made known to us.” Luke 2:15
2026-12-25.daily_watchword: Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path. Psalm 119:105
special_remarks: Watchword for Christmas Day — Jesus is the reflection of God’s glory and the exact imprint of God’s very being, and he sustains all things by his powerful word. Hebrews 1:3
Nativity of the Lord (Christmas Day) — Isaiah 52:7-10; Psalm 98

2026-12-26.prayer: Faithful God, we wait in anticipation of the realization of your word in our lives. Assured that your promise was fulfilled through Jesus, we are deeply grateful to you for sending your son, Jesus, to adopt us as your children. Thank you, Lord. Amen.
2026-12-26.doctrinal: But when the fullness of time had come, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under the law, in order to redeem those who were under the law, so that we might receive adoption as children. Galatians 4:4-5
2026-12-26.daily_watchword: [The LORD said to Jeremiah,] “I am watching over my word to perform it.” Jeremiah 1:12

2026-12-27.prayer: Merciful God, we humbly come before you today seeking forgiveness for the times we falter and sin against you. Lord, be our guiding light in times of failure. Thank you for redeeming us through Jesus’ sacrifices, and for the gift of forgiveness, which we humbly accept, knowing that we do not deserve it. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-27.doctrinal: In him we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace. Ephesians 1:7
2026-12-27.daily_watchword: Happy are those whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered. Psalm 32:1
2026-12-27.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — But when the fullness of time had come, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under the law, in order to redeem those who were under the law, so that we might receive adoption as children. Galatians 4:4,5

2026-12-28.prayer: Loving God, we express our deepest gratitude for the abundance in our lives. We humbly ask that you bless and multiply our efforts in sharing your love. May our actions be filled with love, and may we always strive for the unity and peace you desire for us. May your peace be with all people. Amen.
2026-12-28.doctrinal: Peace be to the brothers and sisters and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Ephesians 6:23
2026-12-28.daily_watchword: Boaz said to the reapers, “The LORD be with you.” They answered, “The LORD bless you.” Ruth 2:4

2026-12-29.prayer: Dear Lord, we ask that you empower us to let go of pride. We recognize our shortcomings and sincerely repent. May your guidance enable us to heed your call, shed the weight of guilt and regret, and walk in obedience to your will. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2026-12-29.doctrinal: He said to him the third time, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter felt hurt because he said to him the third time, “Do you love me?” And he said to him, “Lord, you know everything; you know that I love you.” John 21:17
2026-12-29.daily_watchword: O God, you know my folly; the wrongs I have done are not hidden from you. Psalm 69:5

2026-12-30.prayer: Shining Light, teach us to live truthfully; guide us to recognize the destructive power of accusation. May we resolve not to judge our brothers and sisters; may our minds be preoccupied with good thoughts— positive and uplifting ideas—not destructive ones. May our hearts overflow with love for each other, and may we remain focused on you. Amen.
2026-12-30.doctrinal: Finally, brothers and sisters, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is pleasing, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence and if there is anything worthy of praise, think about these things. Philippians 4:8
2026-12-30.daily_watchword: Keep far from a false charge. Exodus 23:7

2026-12-31.prayer: Holy God, we come before you with humility and in obedience. May we always be mindful of our duty to obey your divine will. Lord, guide us with your light. Teach us to obey your commandments, and heed your warnings so we may genially carry out your will as true members of your sacred family. We are grateful for your love and acceptance as we enter this new year. Hold onto us, Lord, and never let us go. Amen.
2026-12-31.doctrinal: For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother. Matthew 12:50
2026-12-31.daily_watchword: Therefore keep the commandments of the LORD your God by walking in his ways and by fearing him. Deuteronomy 8:6
